1.review: We went on a Wednesday night and the place is busy.   We sat at the sushi bar as the place is fully booked.  The waiter was friendly and service was good.   Food are delicious and portions are reasonable.   The five spice pork rib is delicious.  Love the restaurant environment.
1.name: Grace Hung

2.review:
The food at Tao is always top notch. The environment makes half the experience. We usually come for special occasions and always have a good time. Today happen to be restaurant week so we all got the 3 course special and got to try almost everything. 

Chicken, salmon and beef. All taste great, chicken slightly on the dry side but the flavor is still very good.
2.name: Canh Tran

3.review: Had a great time here! Everything was so good! I heard a lot about this place and finally got here! Beautiful and very nice service. Stuff is great. Food is something , be honest didn’t expect it could be so good
3.name: Kim Lee

4.review:
It is not a bad restaurant. We enjoyed the settings a lot. We tried 2 starters, 1 code fish and the chef's choice of 99$ sushi. 

Unfortunately the food wasn't as good as we anticipated. The starters were okay, a bit too much sugar and teriyaki sauce on the chicken satay and the meat itself was not of the finest quality. 

The code fish was amazing

The sushi was no more than okay... We were two and we probably should've ordered a smaller dish because we didn't finish the everything.

All and all - it wouldn't be my first choice for a good Asian. But maybe it was just a week evening for the chef...
4.name: Or Shachar

5.review: This place, as expensive and packed as it is, is always worth it. I’ve been to TAO a few times and the food is off the charts. The service is honestly hit or miss, I have had great service but I’ve also waited for 20 minutes for even a glimpse of my waitress. But the food... the food is amazing. The wagyu skewers are something I literally dream about, definitely give them a try!
5.name: Madison Fischer

6.review: All types of food available, and for the price there is an excellent portion for each food on the menu! The restaurant looks amazing and lots of photos can be taken. The bathroom, however, has an extremely horrifying vibe. Almost reminds me of a horror film. There is a gigantic doll-like lady painting glowing with the help of this one tiny yellow light, and I almost pooped my pants when I turned around and saw it. Luckily, there was a toilet right there. What a unique vibe. Would come again!
6.name: bella

7.review: My date and I went for an early dinner. We had a great time, the food was delicious, and the drinks were well prepared.  Very good service also. Loved the interior. Fun, positive experience overall. We would go again, which is my form of high praise.
7.name: A

8.review: My boyfriend came here last Halloween weekend. We were staying at the hotel above it. This restaurant was an amazing experience. If you happen to be in Manhattan I definitely recommend coming here. The whole atmosphere is breath taking from the entrance to the stairs to your table. The food was very tasty as well. This is definitely a great date night spot. The drinks weren’t too expensive and they were not shy with putting the right amount of alcohol.
8.name: Jonique Ambrose

9.review: Love this place. Been here a ton. One of the top atmospheres in NYC. Club is packed but fun. Food is amazing if you know what to get. Music is great. Price is expensive but not ridiculous.
9.name: Tony Jones

10.review: Great atmosphere and music. Unbelievably Delicious food and great desert. Very friendly service. Got seated immediately with reservation. Very large portions, good enough for two.
10.name: Yann27

11.review:
Brought my boyfriend here for his birthday and we always come back for the Lo Mein together!!

I've been here a few times now and it always feels as special as the first time! The artwork in the space is always a wow factor, and the seating on the staircase is super unique and interesting. 

The service is professional and doesn't bother you too much while you're dining which we greatly appreciate. 

If you're not looking to dine, they have a bar which is equally as amazing to sit at with a friend, guest, or partner. I love TAO Downtown!
11.name: Mandy Lopata

12.review: In my opinion you’re just paying to eat at ‘Tao’, but money is deserved elsewhere. Although the salmon & avocado roll was probably, the best tasting sushi I’ve had by far. Everything else was just standard, expected it to have more flavour and life for the dishes. Upon walking in I felt like I was being judged by the receptionist as their vibes were just off. No need to be snobby for a high chain restaurant, it’s all about having customer service and putting a smile on. I’m glad they didn’t have a tip option when my bill was given to me. Because they don’t deserve no extra money from nobody!
12.name: Nadia

13.review:
If you enjoy spending $100 (a person) for food that tastes like Panda Express, Tao is the place for you! The service was great, but the cost for quality was absolutely ridiculous. They’re charging for their ambiance but there are many better places with superior ambiance for a much better value.

Went here for for an anniversary dinner and left feeling like i was just a part of their assembly line.
13.name: Bailey Holloway

14.review: Loved the food and I had a great time. Chicken gyoza was amazing and I ended up ordering a second order of it. I'll definitely come back to this play. It's a bit pricey but the food is delicious and a great place to take a date. Highly recommend it.
14.name: Andy Mejia

15.review: Excellent food and service. Love the atmosphere and decor. We had a party of 16 and were well accommodated for.  Enjoy:)
15.name: Sandra Marquez

16.review: Been here multiple times and we always had a fabulous time. The place is huge with amazing ambience and a very beautiful Asian style decor. It's on the pricier side like any other trendy lounges in the city. The food is good and so are the drinks( really expensive cocktails though). Perfect place for celebrations as they have huge tables for big groups and also for dates. They do take reservations which is great because this place is almost always packed. I've also visited their other locations in the city and those are great too with some really gorgeous decor and beautiful ambience.
16.name: Niv Pai

17.review: If you enjoy spending more then $100 (a person) for food that tastes like Panda Express, Tao is the place for you! The service was great, but the cost for quality was absolutely ridiculous. Totally override.
17.name: Israel Bahar

18.review: Went there second time and it was a huge disappointment. First time we went with friends during restaurant week. It was mid week and early evening hours. We liked it although found it not to be as special as it was always pictured by others. Second time we want with friends on Friday night and it was pretty bad. Starting with a very pretentious host. Cold, avoiding eye contact lady that with all her body language and tone was letting us know that she is in charge and she can rule us here the way she likes. We did not get warm greetings, only standard phrases with cold voice. Interior is indeed impressive, beautiful. The way place was packed with tables you would think that has been experiencing financial problems and desperately trying to maximize profit by any means. We were sitting at a table near by bar. That was main pass to tables further down. The distance between bar and my sit was about 2 feet. Every single person who was passing could not avoid pushing my chair or touching my head. Busboy touched by head with the basket of clean wet classes that he was caring (I am sure unintentionally, just no space to be more in control of what he was caring). Food was ok, but nothing extraordinary. Our entire group agreed that it just doesn't worth it at all. May be it was a cool place for cool folks at some point but definitely no longer in our opinion.
18.name: Dr. Who Time Lord

19.review: Restaurant week helped make this spectacular restaurant more affordable.  The food is very good, however the salmon is overcooked for my taste.  Next time I would specify medium rare.  The restaurant design is amazing.
19.name: Tim Grunwald

20.review: The most amazing experience I've had in a long time. The food, the cocktails, the service, the ambience..... it's an amazing experience!
20.name: Danielle Millet

21.review:
Went here after visiting the auto show. 
With toddler and wife.
We absolutely loved this place didn’t get seated in the main area but in the lounge and bar area.
Loved the food!!!!
Loved the drinks!!!
Loved the vibe!!!
And loved the service!!!

A bit on the pricier side but what do you expect for a premier Asian restaurant in trendy Meatpacking!!!

Can’t wait to go back for Mother’s Day!!!
21.name: Alex Duque

22.review: Yea really bloddy good, really good. Stayed next door at Dream Downtown so this was not only convenient for us but the food was great and the atmosphere was awesome!
22.name: Miggsy

23.review: Amazing place with great tasting food. Stunning setting and great atmosphere. Highly recommended.
23.name: Jrs Jones

24.review: Amazing restaurant!! Every single aspect is taken to the max, the food is amazing, the decor is breath taking and the service is excellent. Prices aren't low at about 100$ per guest, but I think it's totally worth it for a special occasion.
24.name: Gal Somekh

25.review: the food is delicious, you should try sushi and also sweet and spicy shrimps. the environment incredible. the best desert molten lava.
25.name: Paula Andrea Ramirez Mendez

26.review: Needless to say ... Fantastic. Great food, great place. Can't go wrong. Definitely steeply priced but bang for the buck.
26.name: Mayur Banwasi

27.review: Larger than life ambience... Service is a hit or miss... Food and cocktails are great.
27.name: Chaitania Kumar

28.review: Cool venue with really good food, high music and nice service. Definitely worth a try if you haven’t visited!
28.name: Sebastian Bierfeldt Liptak

29.review: Excellent restaurant, very tasty, pricy but well worth it. Very nice ambiance if you want combine good food with a nice conversation. Just a bit less trendy than other location’s
29.name: Lusi Wang

30.review:
Amazing restaurant! The food was so delicious and the dishes were big (more than we thought it would be). the atmosphere was great.
I will come back again!
30.name: or rozen

31.review: Had a very bad experience for my first time at Tao where I celebrated my bday. Waitress was rude, spilled water on the table, and refused to separate our checks. She wasn’t attentive at all. Only person who wished me happy birthday was security. I think the place really have to train their staff better because it was level of cheap fast food chain.
31.name: Alexey Kudryavtsev

32.review: Great food and ambiance..  the service could use some improvement as we barely saw our waitor... He came once, then disappeared for long periods of time. And I think the floor manager took our order. Our bill had stuff on it we didn't order, but was fixed once brought to their attention. The restaurant could use some brushing up on the service side of things.. .
32.name: Mandana Rostamian

33.review: I came in on a Friday evening. The food was good but it was the service that really deserved the 5 stars. Our server, Claudia, was so funny and very personable. She answered all our questions and was very attentive to our table. Her recommendations were amazing. Will be requesting her for our next reservation.
33.name: Sarah Galarza

34.review: This place was phenomenal. The ambiance was amazing and the food was delicious and the service was great as well. I had the spicy tuna tartar on crispy rice, Lobster wontons, Lobster and shrimp egg rolls and the Drunken Lobster Pad Thai. All of the food was so good. I will definitely be returning.
34.name: A Phox

35.review: If you need to impress someone, bring them here. Fancy Asian vibe albeit prices are $$$$$. I find they excel more in seafood. Sushi are a must try, also miso cod, dumplings. My guests always enjoy the shrimp lettuce cups and chicken lollipops, one tried the Peking duck and it's alright too- note that it's good enough to serve about 4 people unless you're really hungry! Tip: they have a midtown location, but I prefer this downtown. I highly recommend making a reservation in advance.
35.name: Divine

36.review: The atmosphere was very pleasant. Our server Craig was awesome, he took his time to explain everything to us. The food was good. A good place dine when visiting  Manhattan.
36.name: Silver Fox Diva

37.review: Oh my god. This was so amazing. Everything from the location to the interior, drinks, food, mood, service was perfect. We went here for New Years Eve for dinner. Dreamt about this meal for a week after! The designs inside the restaurant are awesome. A must go to restaurant!
37.name: Monica Voldsund

38.review: Came here to party and I had a really fun time. Service was pretty good at our table as well. It was really crowded for a while and suddenly the crowd lessened. I enjoyed the music as well. Very nice upscale club to go to. Would definitely come back again to party with more friends.
38.name: Jacqueline G

39.review: Was there this week, one of my favorite places to go. Great atmosphere, great food, great service.
39.name: joey rehavi

40.review: Nice atmosphere, great food and music.   Celebrated my birthday there 👍  👍  .
40.name: leroy charles

41.review: What a great time!  Food and drinks were fabulous and the atmosphere was amazing.
41.name: James C

42.review:
I made reservations for my friend’s birthday and when we arrived I was told I had none (despite receiving a confirmation call). After 5 minutes of arguing, I was told it was booked under a wrong name. 
Once we were seated it took 15 minutes before a server even approached the table, understandably it was a busy night but still!! We ordered from the restaurant week menu. I ordered a hot entree and my friend ordered sushi which came out nearly 40 minutes before mine!! Sooo annoying and just lack of common sense. Egg rolls comparable to Panda Express.
42.name: Deena Gurbani

43.review: Very seductive. Delicious soup and very nice portions ✌  👍
43.name: Sidonie Davy

44.review: Excellent ambiance. An amazing server Server Kemac. The food was presented well and very tasty. We had 2 coctails, 3 entrees and 1 appetizer....$169.
44.name: Cheryl Morrison

45.review: Food absolutely horrible. Nothing like Tao Uptown. The menu isn't even the same. Literally, we all ended up sick!! Something super gross and unappealing when the vegetable fried rice comes out completely green💩. Nothing good comes out of grren rice!! Cocktails and decor are Tao downtown's only saving grace.
45.name: Melissa Capes

46.review: Food, Atmosphere, and service. Come looking sharp, everyone is watching. It is a great place to visit as a tourist.
46.name: Philippe Numa, Jr.

47.review: Amazing spicy tuna with the crispy rice, glazed bbq chicken with the green curry is to die for !! With the curry egg plant amazing and the sushi is so fresh and amazing !
47.name: Pam Beasly

48.review: Haven't ever felt myself so humiliated and disrespectful for the money we paid at that place. Horrible service, very unprofessional staff when it comes to client service, one and a half hour long waiting period to the point you forgot why you came there and lost any desire to stay at that place. Four of us who enjoy going out to great places vouched to never going there again!
48.name: Yuliya Avezbakiyeva

49.review: Overall everything is good and excellent,the server was friendly ..the place is fancy and I think this count it for fine dinning :) ..
49.name: Raymond Bong

50.review: Very expensive but well worth it. Be careful, when the drinks add up so does the bill. The food and service was excellent. And I loved the seating area. The crowd was mixed and was diverse on age but everyone seemed to dress upscale. The serving size was very generous. I had the beef and broccoli, and soy brussel sprouts.. Delicious.. And after dinner we went to the attached night club and had a blast.. If you want to have a great night out, definitely go but make sure you do it after payday.
50.name: Anthony Black

51.review: Very cool experience for a nice night out. Busy but not overcrowded. Sat at the sushi bar and ordered a king salmon roll, crispy rice tuna, the olive fried rice, and spicy chili chicken. Everything was very solid. I absolutely adored the king salmon roll. Rice was cooked perfectly with fresh asparagus and salmon. The crispy rice was also very yummy. I would recommend sticking to the items with fresh ingredients though, I wasn’t a huge fan of the chili chicken with heavy breading and a super sticky sauce with undercooked onions. However, the ambiance and great sushi still earned it a solid 4 stars in my book. Not to mention the service at the sushi bar was friendly and prompt.
51.name: Corey Limbowski

52.review: My friend decided to celebrate her birthday at Tao. We did our research and I'm happy to say that the service matched the reviews. Its edgy vibe and they played a lot of dancehall and reggae music while we were there (as a Jamaican this was a big plus for me). We ordered different dishes and we all enjoyed them. The staff was very accommodating especially when they found out that it was my friend's birthday. Unfortunately I didn't get the name or a picture of my server however he danced and pirouetted between the several tables that he was taking care of. He was very friendly but not over the top and very polite and professional. We enjoyed ourselves and will return for another evening out.
52.name: Alicia Christian

53.review:
It’s super stylish place, the design is awesome as long as you stay a way from the food...
It’s basic , Asian take away chip food...

The service is not as professional as the price....

I would come to have a drink, see the design and go to eat somewhere else
53.name: Ella Avnon

54.review: Fabulous atmosphere and service. The ahi tuna and teriyaki cauliflower are very tasty.
54.name: Diego Novillo

55.review: I really like that place food is good and party is good also. Good people and good service
55.name: Malvina Novikova

56.review: I love all the Tao restaurants and clubs. The food is always great and the ambiance is sexy and fun. I want to give Tao Downtown 5 stars but my most recent experience there I was with a group of 6 others and the service was terribly slow. We had to wave down a server to get more bottle of water and cocktails multiple times... I don’t know why the staff was quite in attentive that evening, especially given that it was a Monday night, so the restaurant wasn’t packed full as it often is Wednesday—Saturday!
56.name: Isabelle Foxx

57.review: One of the best, if not the best Asian food in town. A must go place filled with an amazing atmosphere and very cool and nice servers and ridiculously amazing food. A very high end place. Also go to their club after...
57.name: Manuel Hernandez

58.review: Delicious food, great ambience. I had a great dinner here with my co-workers. We got a varied menu that was served family-style, and everyone got something they liked
58.name: J. Gomes

59.review: Lana was an awesome server!!! Great food, good vibes. My girlfriend had an awesome time. I would give it 4.5 because the drinks were subpar. I would def would come back.
59.name: Alex Marquetti

60.review: The service could improve, bit less arrogant and helpless (can’t tell you on the phone if there are free tables available NOW instead telling you to come back at 11 pm ) But the ambiance is nice, beautiful decor and love the special effects with the Buddha. Reminds me a bit of the Buddha Bar in DubaiThe Food came fast everything was delicious! Really amazing except the Toro Roll. Not my first time eating toro and this one tasted way too fishy almost as if spoiled. We wanted to go to Buddakan first but i am happy that we decided to go to Tao! Would definitely go there again :)
60.name: Edna Banks

61.review: It can be a little loud but great date spot nonetheless.  Chilean sea bass and the dumplings were my girlfriend's and my favorites. Reasonable prices for the quality. The succulent fish melts in your mouth. I can't wait to go back.
61.name: Thomas Carvetti

62.review: The receptionist was extremely rude as she didn't even bother calling us nor greeting when we approach the desk (the tall, short hair hostess was better).  That ruined the first impression. Nice decor and food. Maybe the music should be Asian.
62.name: Audrey Vergara

63.review: Reminds me of the song "One Night in Bangkok." Good food and nicely appointed, but a bit too many people, too lavish, decadent and posh for my taste! But if you like that downtown club feel then you would probably give it 5 stars!
63.name: Sy Burgess

64.review: Vibe is always cool but this time the food was just ok . The duck rice was eeeh but salmon poke is great . Hospitality was top notch. It's usually 4 STAR so if your considering going , GO;
64.name: JoJo Brim

65.review: Amazing food, service and vibe. Really cool place!
65.name: Julia Silveira

66.review: Loved this place my friends and I had fun here  and the food is amazing. Highly recommended!
66.name: Lucas DiCarlo

67.review: I had a waiter named Alexandra and she charged my card twice, they continuously take card knowing that their system is trash so, just be careful!!!!!! And make sure you know how much your charge should be!!!
67.name: Amie Koroma

68.review: We didn’t like the food and the service was terrible
68.name: Mercedes Kalaizic

69.review:
By far, the best restaurant I've ever dined at for Asian cuisine. (I recommend the Peking duck)

Service 10/10
Food 10/10
Atmosphere 10/10
69.name: kevin van der welle

70.review: Lovely atmosphere, quick service, and excellent food. Well seasoned and doesn't leave you overwhelmingly full.
70.name: Laura G

71.review: The pork bao was so good, as well as lo mein and the mochi for dessert. Amazing dinner@
71.name: Niki Guilz

72.review:
Service could have been a bit better.  Food took long to come out, but it was really good when it finally came.  
Try the beef short ribs.  You will not be disappointed!
72.name: Ayanna Bullock

73.review: Food was mediocre for what should be a high standard of price for food. Atmosphere is nice and they have some nice seating. At first they sat my date and I at a two seating area that faces the famous sculpture however it was too loungy to sit there as werent going for cocktails. This is not a place for sushi, please get some form of protein and meat as it is heavier and has alot more flavour. Desserts are amazing and the true plus. A place to go to once in a ever five year basis. Better with groups and friends than a date.
73.name: Felix Geyzer

74.review:
Wow just wow. If you want to impress a date take them here. Vast restaurant, amazing decor. Amazing food.

Servers suck in my opinion. Didn’t have a clue what halal was. And had the personality of a potato. Everyone can have an off night but they just dragged like a wet mop. 

Black cod best taste and worst would be the dragon. Expensive place but worth it for the odd night
74.name: Fahad Khan

75.review: Second experience was much worse than first. My husband made reservations for my birthday requested a table at the booth on the balcony. Was told there is no reservations on the balcony. We got there and were told that all the table in the booths are reserved. I asked how come we were not able to reserve it and were told because they reserve it for 6 people but not 2. When asked if there is a table downstairs we were not told NO and were seated in the lounge. What is the point of making a reservation ahead of time when you get seated in the lounge? But we got the table in the booth for an hour. Ordered the same dishes we had before like my favorite Chinese broccoli. Mongolian beef had just the name, nothing to do with the actual dish. The short rib was magnificent, tender and good flavor. Chinese broccoli when was totally different,, instead of being crunchy and light, this time it was soggy, fatty, salty and overly garlicky.  Eggplant was the same as last time, pretty good.   We were served quite fast, as all of the dishes seemed precooked.  In other words we ate fast and left. Never coming back.
75.name: E G

76.review: Admittedly, went for a private event, so can't say this would be the typical experience. But the staff was delightful, the food very good, the bartenders friendly and efficient, the sound system booming and the bathrooms were clean. It was a very enjoyable night and Tao hit on all points.
76.name: Amy McCloskey

77.review: Worth trying. Food and cocktails taste good.
77.name: L C

78.review: Excellent Asian fusion food in equally superb surroundings. Couple this with top notch service and you won't mind paying the somewhat high prices.
78.name: Matthew Saunders

79.review: Great food and service. The interior is insane
79.name: Cassie Ousta

80.review: Food was ok, well what I had at least, and the atmosphere was slightly high class.
80.name: Gio Jean-Philippe

81.review: Loved it!  It's a beautiful space. Service was great.  I loved the front door! We came up from Philly to gather here. We had a small group and ordered lots of appetizers.  The music was pretty hip. I would definitely go again.
81.name: Christopher L. Brown

82.review: The decor of this restaurant is absolutely beautiful. The seating along the stairs is perfect for date night, intimate settings, & people-watching. They have private seating on stage that is perfect for groups. I had the Thai Sweet & Spicy Shrimp & Bok Choy. The shrimp was good and reminded me of sweet & sour chicken. The bok choy was okay, it's sauteed with garlic, but it was a bit watery for my liking. Our experience was spoiled by our waitress, though. She was awful. We had to chase her down the entire night, and when we were able to catch her, she'd run off again before we could ask for everything we needed. She didn't check to see if our food was delivered, nor did she check to see if everything was okay with the food or if we needed anything else. It was a friend's birthday & when it was time to bring out the dessert, she placed it in front on me, bc she was too busy to clear the area in front of the bday girl. I told the waitress it was her birthday, so she knew it wasn't for me. That was extremely frustrating for us.
82.name: Jam Coy

83.review:
Pretty impressive interior. Definitely makes you pause and take it in.

The food was okay. Overpriced for what you get.  I had a couple of rolls, and some special hamachi dish. None of it blew me away.

I went myself (on a business trip) to grab a quick dinner. Restaurant was full but I was able to sit at the bar. Decent service. 

I wouldn't go back again myself, but would be inclined with a group or for an event to enjoy the ambiance.  Hopefully next time I end up ordering some really memorable dishes.
83.name: chris chan

84.review: Hosted a bachelor party dinner here. They gave us the big round table in the a separate area at no extra charge. From the moment you walk through the big front doors, to the feeling you get walking down the main staircase, the venue is magnificent. The food is as good as the place is beautiful. The service was top notch. Highly recommended.
84.name: Kevin Nguyen

85.review: Ambiance is great, food is alright for my taste. The service is also good.
85.name: Sajna Kuldip

86.review: Absolutely loved it.. Lot of veg options. The ambience was mind blowing. The service was great. A must go for a celebration or something special..
86.name: Nilika Mistry

87.review: Amazing! DELICIOUS!!!!RESTAURANT WEEK HERE IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST!  THANK YOU FOR NOT BEING CHEAP TAO! ! TUNA TARTARE CRISPY ROLLS AND SHRIMP PAD THAI ABD SUSHI ROLLS AND CHOCOLATE MOLTEN LAVA CAKE IS TO DIIIIIIIEEEEEE FOR! BETTER THAN ANY HOT SEX!
87.name: veronica Palazzolo

88.review: Love it! The food tastes great, the service is very good and the portions are very big too! Desserts are great , you can split! It is always good to be back!
88.name: Wladimir Coutinho Mesquita

89.review: In one ☝   word. Sexy. The experience you have from the entrance to the custom cocktails - the 5 spice Manhattan - to the tuna tartare is one ☝   you must have if in New York City for any period time. It’s like entering a whole new 🌍
89.name: Gina Diamond

90.review: Wow! This 0lace was astonishing! Huge place, amazing food, even the bathrooms were fancy! They practically was your hands for you, and on your way out you can take a candy. There is a large structure at the front of the restaurant, and it's sitting in a pond with fish in it!!!!  I seriously recommend this place, you have to go there at least once in your lifetime.
90.name: -Lunar Dayz-

91.review: Very trendy and romantic place with outstanding cuisine. Equally good for dinner, quick bites or just drinks. Very nice crowd. The place is really big.
91.name: Alex Serebrov

92.review: I love this place.  The food is wonderfully tasty and the ambiance is fantastic!!
92.name: joyce barnes

93.review: Great Asian food, with a surprisingly big dining area and quite different and attractive interiors. The staff are extremely helpful, though they can get over-attentive when the place isn't full - in our case the waitress came to us 4 times in 15-odd minutes despite having ordered drinks and starters. The food is quite good, and the place has quite a few good vegetarian dishes also, which is somewhat unusual for NY Asian eateries.
93.name: Nitesh Misra

94.review: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere.  I love the way this place is laid out with the tables on the stairs. But the food is insanely good as well.
94.name: Michael Hannigan

95.review:
The food is great but the service from servers is not as upscale as you expect from a restaurant like TAO.
the bartender at the bar had so much attitude for no reason, and our server at our table was very average and often took her so long to visit us when we needed her.
95.name: Sam Ramezanli

96.review: It asian budha and the design of this place is very impressive. I Loved it
96.name: Mariame Keita

97.review: Not cheap but the portions are great and the quality is spectacular.
97.name: James Nichols

98.review: Absolutely love the decor in this place, nothing comes close - it is very upscale and luxurious. The food tastes great as well, they have a wide variety of cuisines to choose from. The only let down for me is the pricing is not justifiable to the taste of the food - you can have better food for less in NYC.
98.name: Freddy F

99.review: amazing food and great staff would recommend 10/10
99.name: roselin garcia

100.review: Good place for a family dinner, Awesome decor, great desserts, definitely try Wagyu Steak, sashimi is ok.
100.name: Rishi Rastogi

101.review: Definitely will return,  food and atmosphere are amazing.
101.name: Edgar Repko

102.review: Amazing atmosphere and food was fantastic. Service on the other hand was not that great, felt very rushed and impersonal. One of the waiters tipped a whole glass of wine over my friend and didnt even apologize, however the manager more than made up for it and removed the wine from our bill and took good care of us the rest of the evening.
102.name: Claire Campbell

103.review: Great place with amazing decor. Food and drinks are amazing, albeit on the pricier side. You can enjoy their full menu in the wait lounge. Lots of great photo ops. I consider this an upgrade over Buddakan across the street.
103.name: Victor Hugo

104.review: Stop by here for an event, set up a whole downstairs. The appetizers weren't interesting, just a selection of things like a California roll. No imagination by the order. The sushi wasn't particularly interesting, although the beef kabob and the spring rolls weren't bad. Dinner was a number of dishes set up buffet style, with servers. The downside was that they tried to make Peking duck with a guy who didn't know how to cut it up quickly and held up the line. Should have made the station separate. The duck ended up being cold by the time you received your food. As well as the rest of your food on your plate was cold by that time that you were served. The best part of the evening probably was actually their snow pea leaf, in a garlic soy. It did seem like much of their food was the same flavor though, with the garlic soy being the predominant sauce.
104.name: Hank Chang

105.review: Great food and atmosphere.  Serving sizes larger than expected. 😀
105.name: Gerry McFaull

106.review: Always love going here. Great food, atmosphere and service
106.name: Saurabh Bagde

107.review: I love Tao, the prices are reasonable and the servers are wonderful, they are friendly, approachable, she explain the menu very well and my server guided my experience.  I recommend the shishito peppers, and the aged sirloin, the pork fried rice.  Everything I order was delicious!!!! To the staff at Tao, Thank you.
107.name: Jose Portillo

108.review:
Tao is the food temple of Asian food.

We arrived with many expectations at this restaurant, many people told us that they eat amazing there, we had to go and find out.
We start with four entries; Tuna tartare, octopus sushi, chicken lollipop and chicken gyoza like dumpling.  
I had already eaten the tuna tartare in other restaurants, I hoped that here I knew the same or better, and it fulfilled my expectation, it is great.  The chicken lollipop is very tasty!  But the best was the Gyoza, a balanced flavor and at its right point.  My disappointment came from the hand of the octopus sushi;  the texture was very hard and lacked flavor.  I would not order it again

We continue with three main courses: Mongolian beef, Thai duck rice and drunken pad Thai with lobster.
The Mongolian beef has been the best dish I have eaten this month, balanced flavors, a soft meat and a very nice presentation, highly recommended!
The Thai duck rice, very tasty too, but the one who takes the best place was the Pad Thai with lobster... a fantastic, hearty, very balanced and tasty dish, a very nice presentation.

Before we left, we ordered a creme brulee.  Very nice but it was a lemon pie mixed with cheese cake .... that is not a creme brulee, however it is very rich.

In Tao you can expect superior food quality, adequate attention times and the best: the place ... incredible details that make you feel in an Indue temple.
Highly recommended this restaurant!
108.name: Mariano Romero

109.review: While the whole atmosphere is very well designed from the interior to the table settings the food was sub-par for the price. The sizzling soy chicken appetizer was quite good but my main entrees were not. I ordered the lobster fried rice and triple pork rice but both seemed like they were cooked in old oil and tasted inedible after a few bites. I sent it back and went for the lo mein which was the same. The service was pretty good but overall didn't seem worth the price point
109.name: Oscar Garcia

111.review: So gorgeous here. I went for my birthday and loved it. It's really dark inside though so you would not really be able to take pictures
111.name: Geetanjali Sankar

112.review: Great food. Big place. It gets very noisy and the music gets too high for people who want to have dinner and talk. If you want to experience a calmer dinner then go earlier like around 6:00
112.name: Hengam R

114.review: Good and good service, great venue, atmosphere and aesthetic. Pad Thai was a bit in the sweet side but otherwise good.
114.name: Sarah O'Connor

115.review: Came here for restaurant week! BLOWN AWAY! So luxurious, beautiful Buddha centerpiece, huge crowds, excellent and delicious food. MUST try the vegetable spring roll for appetizers. My pad thai bowl was huge. Left feeling full and paid a great affordable price because of restaurant week deal! What a gorgeous atmosphere, even the bathroom area is a party!
115.name: Yelena Levy

116.review: I got the fried rice. It had 0 flavor. Terrible.
116.name: Marie Ucker

117.review: This place never lets me down.
117.name: Tee Tee O

118.review:
This is your go to upscale Asian food spot. my girlfriend and i came here to celebrate a birthday. This can come with a big group or it can be a great place for an intimate date. While you wait to be seated there is a bar/ lounge area where a waiter can get you drinks (we went for the red dragon, it was great). 
The service was prompt, the ambiance was nice and the food was great. 
We started off with a sushi roll and pork pot stickers. Both tasted really good. The pot stickers were crunchy and hot and the sushi tasted fresh. 
For our entree we opted for the Singapore Mei Fun noodles and asked for it to come spicy. It was good and spicy but kind of dry so we asked for Hoisoin sauce which made the dish amazing.
For dessert we tried the banana pudding which was topped with tempura bananas and freshly cracked wafers. I loved it
There chicken lomain is very delicious is very refilling and satisfing. you can never go wrong on tao restuarant. 

IG @kenexplorer
118.name: Kenneth Cheatham

119.review:
Definitely a place to go for dinner,either with  lots of friends or just dinner for two. My daughter and I sat at the sushi bar.All the servers were very friendly and gracious.
The food was outstanding!  I really liked the ambiance as well,it was a large space but not too big or noisy.Allthe guests around us were having a great time. I'm going to try to go again next time I'm in the city.
119.name: rich cannon

120.review: Amazing ambience, service and food. We had the vegetarian spring roll which comes with an amazing mustard sauce, pork buns. The scene stealers were the Olive fried rice and the lobster fried rice. We will definitely be back.
120.name: Ritesh Poddar

121.review:
You’re coming here for the aesthetic and once you’ve decided that, you’ll have a great time. 

Lean towards coming for group celebrations where meaningful conversation is not the goal.
121.name: Daniel McDonald

122.review: great sevice, amazing ambiance and tasty food
122.name: Deniz Senelt Kalelioglu

123.review: Great place, service is super and the food is very delicious. Nice experience and will be back
123.name: Walid Attia

124.review:
Average experience.
As a beginning, we had to wait 20 minutes to be sitted, even though we reserved a table a month in advance.
Food was good, but nothing special.
The place itself is beautiful! But it was freezing in there, and REALLY loud.
Service was not good, the waiteress was impatient, and it took forever to find her.
124.name: Eden Ben Oz

125.review: wonderful, cool, great good. loved it.
125.name: Loredana Mariotto

126.review: Food and service was excellent.  Price was a bit high for what it was.
126.name: Christopher Artibee

128.review: Great ambience and very good food. The bar is beautiful. The Ruby red dragon cocktail is a must try
128.name: Akshay Kapoor

129.review: Very cool experience for a nice night out. Busy but not overcrowded. Sat at the sushi bar and ordered a king salmon roll, crispy rice tuna, the olive fried rice, and spicy chili chicken. Everything was very solid. I absolutely adored the king salmon roll. Rice was cooked perfectly with fresh asparagus and salmon. The crispy rice was also very yummy. I would recommend sticking to the items with fresh ingredients though, I wasn’t a huge fan of the chili chicken with heavy breading and a super sticky sauce with undercooked onions. However, the ambiance and great sushi still earned it a solid 4 stars in my book. Not to mention the service at the sushi bar was friendly and prompt.
129.name: Leah Hubert

130.review: Great place for peoplewatching, great venue!
130.name: Johan Petter Mæhre

131.review: Food was good, ambiance very nice was worth the trip.
131.name: Janice Sanderson

132.review: Dined here for my 30th birthday. I wanted to eat here 3 weeks prior but they were all booked. If you want to come here and you have a big party, book weeks in advance. They book up quick despite how big the restaurant is. It's beautiful inside though. Reminds me of Spice Market from a few years back. There's a beautiful tunnel you walk down before you get to check in and then walk on to the dining floor. There is a lot to choose from on the menu and we tried a little bit of everything. Everything was delicious. Definitely get the giant fortune cookie! The bathrooms are interesting... there's even a bar inside. The service was great. Our waitress was sweet, helpful and made sure it was all perfect for my party and experience.
132.name: Chinh Chinh

133.review: This is place is really amazing. Must visit place, their service and quality is really great. Must try is the Firecracker shrimp. We love this place the ambiance, food, atmosphere is really fantastic.
133.name: Saurabh Rakhunde

134.review: Food & staff were amazing. Loved the music and ambiance
134.name: David Ash

135.review: Came here with my wife for my birthday Dinner. I been wanting to go here for quite some time. When we arrived we were amazed by the decor and dark lounge feel. Hostess where great as they sat us to our table. Our server was good but she was pretty absent most of the time. I ordered a chicken gyoza,sushi roll, bao Buns, salmon Entree. Rolls where tasty but I was expecting something better than what I get at my local sushi spot. Bao Buns where a little different but tasty, gyoza was ok seemed fresh but lacked flavor, my salmon looked beautifully plated but it was extremely dry with over cooked vegetables. Overall the ambiance and scenery where amazing but the food was not what I was expecting. I will return but only for the drinks.
135.name: Souschef at DEE

136.review: Bad service and filthy.. there was a white piece of rice stuck on the cup and told me it was just a crack on cup. After I told him it was filthy he kept pouring our sake into the cup, after server looked careful and apologize, he pours the sake out of the filthy cup into a new cup and hands it to me.😠😠😠 Then when he hand us our sauce dish, it also was a red piece of food stuck on it.... I told him again that the sauce dish is also filthy. Then he said, oh it must be your lucky day. Everytime the server came and check on us, he always speak in a very ghetto tone... Which is very unprofessional for a restaurant that charges everything over price and give bad service. All plates that came on table was either filthy or cracks and chips on plates. Can go anywhere and have much better tasting food with service at a fraction of the price.
136.name: Andrew Wong

137.review: One of my favorite restaurants. Love the food there and the drinks are delicious. Order the Tao-tini.
137.name: Racquel Cousins, Esq.

138.review: It's been a long time since i had a bad culinary experience like this one today.  Boiled noodles swimming in sweet sauce as dessert. Uneatable.The dish was replaced with fried stired rice and with chicken, carrots and vegetables. A pointless dish. I had to pour the whole bottle of soy to eat from hunger. Chicken gyoza is good. Chicken satay is not bad and nothing more. A souffle dessert that was not baked enough The spilled chochlate is a mixture of unbaked dough with chochlate. If you ask yourself what is the interesting sauce on the side of the dessert . I believe it is syrup to treat cough. The place is crowded and unpleasant to sit. There is a feeling that you can eat from the plate of the table next to you. We came back with no voice. the bad acoustics and the noise of the people forced us to shout.  Prices are high.  Even if the management responds it will be my worst memory from New York.  Send the owner to the Far East or even to China town to learn how to prepare Asian food.  Apparently the chef never ate Asian food before. TRUST ME TOURISTS !
138.name: Itay Madenfrost ADV

139.review: LOVE LOVE LOVE Tao  Downtown with reservations... so worth the wait!
139.name: Beautiful Bridal Accessories

140.review:
(Club) Overpriced. Overcrowded. Overrated.
Bought expensive tickets for New Year's Eve at TAO. Despite having purchased these tickets, waited 30+ minutes in the rain. When we finally got inside, waited another 10 for coat check. On the bright side, the music was great. Unfortunately, the club was so crowded that people were shoulder to shoulder and physically couldn't dance. TAO definitely overbooked. It was a warzone. 
Don't waste your time or money.
140.name: Nicole Brown

141.review: Good place to go as well as a backup for PHD.
141.name: André Fontoura

142.review: Excellent party place food portions are little small for the price
142.name: Yoshita Childress

143.review: We sat at our table for a good 30 minutes. During that time, no one acknowledged our presence or tried to ask us if we wanted to order so we left.
143.name: camille delezoide

144.review:
Went on a Saturday night at 8:30PM and it was PACKED. Reservations are highly recommended. We got lucky and were seated in the lounge area by someone who saw us struggling to find a seat, props to them.
Once seated, service was very quick and attentive. Food came out relatively quick for the quality that it had. Had roll and some gyoza for apps, main was BBQ duck fried rice. Very well made. Definitely higher quality than take-out. The dishes actually come as sizes for sharing, so be mindful of the portion. One can always take whatever is left home. For dessert, had the creme brulee. Also share size, couldn't finish it.
Overall it was just a very good experience. From the ambiance and decor, to the attentiveness of service. Will go back again.
144.name: Jorge Sandoval

147.review: Had a very nice Birthday dinner with family. Meal size is pretty fully for one person, nice decor and friendly staff. Very good collection of wine, ofcourse a bit pricey. The meals were expensive  but delicious.  I wish we had more options for food and rolls. The service was good
147.name: Shukhrat Maks

148.review: Beautiful restaurant. Service was ok. Food not good. Too expensive.
148.name: Sasa Dada

149.review: Amazing vibe, food is great, wonderful experience
149.name: Robin Kohl

150.review: They have really made something beautiful. Fun place to visit. Although not my kind of place, I got here for a friend's birthday and I think it all went well. Food was good, and we all agreed it was a good night.
150.name: Patti Newsong

151.review: One of my favorite spots to meet with friends and have a good time. The food and drinks are always delicious and it has the perfect party atmosphere that is fun and sophisticated. Always look forward to coming here. Their gluten free options are also very good! My fav is the lychee martini :)
151.name: Kimmy Blindski

152.review: This place is essentially P.F. Chang’s on steroids. While I don’t mind paying for good food, the dishes here range from mediocre to terrible, making the prices borderline offensive.  The space is big and cavernous, but the ambience feels artificial/fake, all the way up to the jumbo plastic Buddha statue.
152.name: Sanjeev Verma

153.review: Delicious food. Beautiful and vibrant ambiance. I love TAO.
153.name: Luciano Miranda

154.review:
Ready to feel like you’re having a meal inside a club/show? 

That’s the ambience TAO has, and I’ve never been anywhere else that gives the same kind of vibe!

Our server was great, and got all our orders to us quickly hence the busy busy night. Their food portions are fair, quality is on point, and authentic tasting. The dishes all had such nice presentation. 

My only complaint is that we placed at 11PM reservation, and we still had to wait when we arrived, and didn’t get seated at our table until almost midnight. So if you’re planning to visit here... be prepared to wait. But overall? Worth it!
154.name: Angel CKY

155.review: Fantastic food, great atmosphere, and very attentive wait staff! Absolutely phenomenal Peking duck and Dim Sum!
155.name: Christopher Knight

156.review: Would give this place 3.5 stars if I could. We came here for a friend's birthday because of SATC. She loved it. The atmosphere is definitely different from the typical NYC restaurant. The place is quite busy and sometimes service was slow. We shared a bunch of different dishes and most of them ranged from decent to not memorable. Nothing was bad but nothing was outstanding either although the chicken dumplings were surprisingly tasty. We ordered some wine bottles we were all happy with. The nicest touch was a giant shared plate dessert they brought out to celebrate our friend's birthday. It has a mix of different things and all of them were delicious!
156.name: Donella Held

157.review: Nice Food and Very good Ambiance. like the decor.
157.name: Ketan Patel

158.review: The food was heavy, a little too salty or sweet here and there. No dish sticks out as amazing. I'm a vegetarian so can't speak for the next dishes, however wife had the fish and agreed with my assessment. Decor is fun and only reason for more than two stars.
158.name: Julien F.

159.review: We are 4 visitors from Toronto, and this was the one recommendation that my friend had referred me to. She raved about this place, and so we were so excited to come here. Made reservations for 11 p.m. (Tao even called us in the morning to confirm our reservation). Arrived on time. At 11:30 p.m., we still weren’t seated. They informed us that they were still seating their 10:30 p.m. reservations and that they couldn’t guarantee how much longer we would have to wait. Given that we did not yet eat dinner and it could be another 30-45 min, we decided to cancel our reservation. The host was super nice and gave us vouchers for complimentary drinks at the bar. She also said we could sit anywhere in the lounge if there was a free seat. We waited for the bartender (male with glasses) to serve us. He didn’t serve us, asked for our IDs but then proceeded to serve other people. He didn’t bother to wait and was extremely rude. No hospitality whatsoever. The fact that we patiently waited for him, quickly got out our IDs, but then had to wait again while he served other patrons... That was pretty despicable service. On top of that, the lounge was packed and bouncers/security just kept on telling people where to stand. And we just always felt like we were in people’s way. Treated like herds of cattle. When some seats opened up, we went to go sit down (we have been standing for an hour now), but one of the servers kicked us out. When other patrons went to sit in those same seats, they did not get kicked out. Quite the double standard in service. Our New York experience has been completely ruined by Tao’s lack hospitality and basic customer service. Their only saving grace was their hostess (Alexa?). We will never be returning to this chain. I can guarantee you that other patrons would never be treated like this in Toronto. I think we’ll stick to our side of the border. Thanks for single-handedly ruining our trip, Tao. It is now 12:30 a.m., and we are headed to Brooklyn for better service. And are still bloody hungry.
159.name: Stephanie Hadi

161.review: For the most parts we liked the food and ambiance. It's really fancy place, people are nicely dressed.  The decor is beautiful, modern and very warm. We got a table in the lounge, which was cool to be upstairs overlooking the main floor and ordered from  full menu which is great! What we did not like. The coconut shrimp is too heavily breaded with regular flower dough which has nothing to do with the coconut shrimp, yes shaved or shredded coconut on the side was the coconut portion. The problem with that was that coconut was sweetened which is all wrong, especially for people who don't do sugar. Abundance of white flower and sweet coconut made this dish uneatable for us. Light tempura breading and unsweetened coconut would have been much better choice  and would allow to taste the shrimp.  And second,  is that one of the candles fell on my very expensive scarf and the sweater covering it with wax! I told the waitress and she suggested to iron it which made matters only worse. in classy restaurant I expect them to take care of a mishap like that or at least reduce the bill by amount of dry cleaning. Of course having candles is quite romantic, but at lease secure them enough so they don't fall on customers.  It's  very nice place, but I would expect a bit  higher level of service.
161.name: Masha Medved

162.review: The food is amazing, the place has such a great vibe.
162.name: Stacy Brock

163.review: What a majestic place, food was Amazing and had a wonderful time. It didnt feel like I was in NY the place has a GRAND presence. Do yourself a favor and try the Lobster Wontons and Seafood Black Rice. Depending on your group it's best to order the Family arrangement to share everything your taste buds will thank you, Enjoy.
163.name: Leo Zuniga

165.review: There needs to be a 10 star category for Tao. The ambiance will take you away, the staff was very friendly, and the food will transform the experience to feeling like you took a mini-vacay!! Loved every bite!!! Even the music was worth mentioning.  This will be a favorite spot for me...well during restaurant week anyway!!!
165.name: Simone Foster

166.review: Delicious food combined with nice staff and cool way to present the restaurant.
166.name: Kjersti Einan

167.review: Impeccable service, incredible environment, love love love. Food was some of the best I’ve eaten, ever.
167.name: Olivia Vranjes

168.review:
Mediocre at best, for the category it is trying to be in.  For same price I'd go to Buddakan across the street, hands down. Actually even Tao uptown seemed better to me, but after this experience downtown I'm wondering whether they have all gone downhill. It was bad from the first moment. The woman seating us was snarly. Then they had told us they seat until 11.45pm no problem, but when we got there (11.36 by the way) they rushed us through the meal. Food was pretty much blah. I even commented that PF Changs is better. For real. I will give ecredit to the waitress though, she was on top of it. And I do love the decor. Well, and it's cool for people watching. But the food is mediocre at best. We had Mongolian beef... or rather, my dog is going to have Mongolian beef later tonight. It was a 3 out of 10. Chicken satay was ok. Salmon tartare was boring. The waitress did try to steer us away from that, in fairness. 8 green rice was ok. Miso sea bass skewers were actually good. 

In summary, a gorgeous decor and fun bar scene, but food is not worth it.
168.name: Omar Hussein

169.review: Impressive decor.  Bartenders are on point.  Food is meh.
169.name: William Wang

170.review: Amazing experience in the meatpacking district of Manhattan. Massive place (a bit loud for deep conversation) with lots of small rooms overlooking the main floor. Pan-Asian describes it well. A great mix of flavors served up well by excellent staff. Pricey and worth it. Be sure to call ahead for reservations.
170.name: Mike Amundsen

171.review: Yes this place is impressive when you walk in. A cavernous eating space with an impressive Buddha statue at one end, but all a bit soulless in my opinion. Food was good without being great. As usual the Asian spin seems to be about adding too much sugar, although  the Lobster fried rice was quite tasty. Do come for the spectacle and to impress some visiting friends or family, but don't come for great food. At those prices there are far better options for amazing food with a much nicer atmosphere.
171.name: Stephen Scammell

172.review: Ambience is awesome and food is also good. Highly recommend it to try once.
172.name: Pankti Bhansali

173.review: Very nice. Great food. Sensory overload....too much going on.
173.name: Jennifer Anglin

174.review: Inside was breathtaking, an Asian themed ambiance with a club-like feel. Aside from the small wait to be seated, everything else was great. From the food and drinks to the service
174.name: kavin gaglus

175.review: Beautiful decor. Good food. Great service.
175.name: Cat is Blessed

176.review: Food is okay it’s better than average. Crowd changes from time to time and can be heavily tourist filled at times. Decor is great.
176.name: Lara Collins

177.review: Excellent food.  Parking right next door. Definitely an experience. Reasonable pricing for NY
177.name: EdAguiles .

178.review: Atmosphere is nice, but food is way too expensive for what you get.
178.name: Jennifer Jimenez

179.review: Beautiful place. What I ordered was not so great. But really great ambience
179.name: cad jina

180.review: This place is awesome. The food is great; everything I order was very teasty. Highly recommend. Very good atmosphere
180.name: ross wilson

181.review: Amaizing food and amaizing place, it's a very nice experience to enjoy with family or friends, the quality of food is exceptional, the design on the plates it's so creative, special review for desserts: The crunchy banana donut was incredible, the perfect day for my wedding, we'll come back for sure.
181.name: Noel Garcia

182.review: Asian fusion food, not authentic, but American. Great dining environment just makes you forget the taste of the food.
182.name: Joey Z

183.review: Trendy Asian fusion restaurant. Food is good but also expensive. Great atmosphere and the DJ is always on point. You might also see somebody famous if you stop by.
183.name: Oliver Surriga

184.review: After making reservation one month ago we went to Tao downtown yesterday to feel deeply disappointed. We had to wait for 45 minutes to be seated. The ladies at the reception were saying your table will be ready in a few seconds but it never happened until I had to express our disappointment to them.We were hosting a few of our guests who came from abroad at Tao.. but unfortunately we had a bad experience as we didn't expect this long waiting time even after having prior reservation. This restaurant has gone down at their customer service and will continue to go down if they don't perform a good customer service. Atleast they should have provided with complimentary drinks or desserts to our table to make a good impression which they didn't even bother to do.
184.name: Sneha Putatunda

185.review: Visited as loved the LA spot. Food was delicious as always. Dumplings were really tasty and the spicy eggplants were one of my favourites. Service was fast and server knowledgeable with menu. Always best to book in advance for a table between 7-10pm when the vibes are best. Mango chilli cocktail had really nice flavours.
185.name: Michelle Lee

186.review: Great ambience. Good service. I prefer it over buddakan
186.name: Emeka Okafor

188.review: Food was amazing and the service was superb
188.name: Shanna Bailey

191.review: Excellent food in a luxurious environment
191.name: Ivan Boluarte

192.review: The food and service was awesome
192.name: Kuwanda Nelson

193.review: Food was okay. Service was decent. Decor was nice. Price wasn't worth it. Better Asian food around the block.
193.name: Elias Kawa

194.review: Tao is an awesome experience. The atmosphere and the food are great. The staff was pleasent and professional.
194.name: SCP Pugh

195.review: An amazing atmosphere to hang out in.
195.name: jenifer Valmon-Alleyne

196.review: Tao is an amazing place to spend an entire evening - dinner to lounge to nightclub.   All amazing!
196.name: Alicia Nicole

197.review: Passsssssss if you're looking for a fun time out.
197.name: Eli H

198.review: TAO turns dinner into an experience. Between the great food, the DJ and the wait staff, you can't go wrong here.
198.name: Devin Fisher

199.review: Epic beautiful space. You should go once to see it but no need to go back. $60 for 3 cocktails.
199.name: Rich Tanksley

200.review: Amazing !!!!! Never paid sooo much for a meal before, but...... it was worth every penny and I go back every time I went to New York. The atmosphere is fantastic, the staff are great and the food is the best I've ever tasted. The Mongolian Beef and lobster rice !!! OMG.....AMAZING. Everyone must go here at least once.
200.name: Richard McLauchlan

201.review: Incredible atmosphere. Chilean Sea Bass skewers were unbelievable. Service was excellent.
201.name: john conroy

202.review:
Absolute garbage. I never post but this place was not worth the time waiting nor the money. 

Way too crowded. Too unorgananized,  not a great time for the money we spent. 

I’d recommend going somewhere else for the club. Restaurant with drinks and music was great but club was very very very bad.
202.name: Tyler Matthews

203.review: So the restaurant is amazing. Every time I see the way the restaurant is situated in the basement, amazes me. Good food to.
203.name: Leonardo Setal

204.review: Birthday gift ftom the love of my life
204.name: Ladybird

205.review: Atmosphere 5 star I also enjoyed the Chilean sea bass satay. Also the fried rice and Dragon Ribs
205.name: Anthony Holloway

207.review: Inside was breathtaking, an Asian themed ambiance with a club-like feel. Aside from the small wait to be seated, everything else was great. From the food and drinks to the service ...all A1! Four stars due to a parking issue.
207.name: Shanice H

208.review: Good food, good crowd, spacious, loud music and good atmosphere.
208.name: Milly ELVIS

209.review: I would give this place 5 stars just for the ambience but the food does not disappoint! Plenty of vegetarian options and the chefs are open to amending dishes as we please. The cocktails were great too, and so was the service!
209.name: S. A.

210.review: Really cool place. Food was good, but what really won me over was the atmosphere. There is so much going on that stimulates your dining experience that all works well together: the lighting, the statue, the table decorations, the room layout, and the music. Definitely a place to check out!
210.name: Ben Leising

211.review:
Very different exotic atmosphere. Great food and very good service.
To
211.name: Raymond Harrison

212.review: Great food and atmosphere. Good service! The spring roll appetizer is always a nice start!
212.name: Gisa Vie

213.review: Atmosphere was great, little cramped but cozy, drinks were yummy! Was only in the dining area and DJ was awesome. I would say something they could do better is have a bit more lively staff, no one really seemed happy. Fried rice was meh, crispy chicken was bomb and so was the short ribs.
213.name: Georgette Miller

215.review:
Great place, the design is gorgeous. We came after 23:00 and the place was really nice, the music was awesome. The most important thing of course was the amazing food.
Really recommended
215.name: Miriam Feldhamer

216.review: Huge galleried basement interior. Decent food, friendly and efficient staff. Quite noisy, but good for a big work meal.
216.name: Sam Dutton

217.review:
Best food after 11:15 am. You can always stop by the bar and grab some food. Food service is fast and quality is decent for a place that has a kitchen open at 2/3am!! Price range $200 for 2. 

Staff is excellent. Professional.

Around the corner they have a club i am about to check out.
217.name: Egor Astakhov

218.review: Great service... Prices are high but that is what you pay for a 'special occasion dining'
218.name: Alok Chadha

220.review: Service a bit stuffy, overpriced and food ok. Bit of scene
220.name: Matthew Lejk

221.review: This place is awesome. The food is great; everything I order was very teasty. Highly recommend. Very good atmosphere. Good service. You must order a place. Go after 23:00 .. good price.
221.name: Adi FeLDi

222.review: All facets of our visit were first class.  Amazing food and service, combined with a mind blowing visual experience.  Tao is a must!
222.name: Dave Cronk

223.review:
Nice experience 
Food is good. The sushi was really good 
Very expensive but don't miss it.
223.name: גיל בר-צבי

224.review: Dramatic setting if also a large space. Attentive and knowledgable service, delicious fish. Will be back for the wagyu tataki.
224.name: A J

225.review: It's a beautiful space. Service was great.
225.name: Herman Lawson

226.review: Great service all around.....for kids and adults.
226.name: Adrian Miller

227.review: Beautiful place and beautiful people. Good to go on Tuesdays night to dance and have fun.
227.name: Amanda Reis

228.review: One of the best restaurants in the world that I know. You will experience a fancy restaurant. The look is something in between a dark temple and a restaurant. It offers space for many guests, but is always well booked so that you should definetly reserve! Food and wine are simply heaven. Service professional. Go and experience it yourself, but don't forget to fill your purse and be prepared that it is not cheap.
228.name: Stf Scw

229.review: Atmosphere was great. Yummy drinks and food
229.name: nicole yull

230.review: Had a reservation but still waited for a whole hour to get our table. Food was good, not amazing, prices were high. It's a nice place if you want to have some drinks in a cool nicely decorated spot.
230.name: Andres Guraieb

231.review: The only thing that was a miss, was the lemongrass creme brulee. The spicy crunchy yellowtail roll was phenomenal and the Hong Kong fried noodles were tasty and pack with an assortment of flavors. The drinks are decent and the service was exceptional. Our server Claudia was quite the gem.
231.name: DC Johnson

232.review: Omg my boyfriend took me to downtown toa for my birthday the food was delicious. The service is great.
232.name: jennis fiorentino

233.review: Incredible incredible incredible. This place is a full experience, from the decor and Hollywood style half moon tables to the stairs and statues. Pictures do not do it justice. The food is excellent, Mongolian Beef, and Spicy Chili Chicken on the top of the bill. Wines are exorbitantly priced, far above rational prices for pretty standard fare. Stick to cocktails, the bartenders are skilled.
233.name: Albert Calabrese

235.review: Theu food is outstanding but service sucks! They treat you as if they are doing you a favor.
235.name: Cecilia Santoscoy

236.review: I love it. The service was good the food was great the Aviance was beautiful. Keep doing what you doing I'll always be a client
236.name: Roosevelt Mikell

237.review: Great food, great atmosphere and impressive Set up. Quite pricey but defiantly worth the money
237.name: aframe241 .

238.review: The food was amazing and the ambience is really cool. Highly recommend for a special occasion.
238.name: Jonathan Crawford

239.review:
Food was incredible, ambience was spectacular ... Service was awful. Non attentive and we spent over $528 on two people. 

Waiter took forever to get our orders and the couple next to us complained as well. Maybe he was new but ... This isn't Applebee's.

Step your game up.
239.name: Matthew Paino

240.review:
This place is located in the lower Manhattan, one of the famous pan asian restaurant in New York, We went to this place for dinner on weekday ( Monday) it was crowded, we did take a reservation. So i advise people to take reservation.

This place is little on expenive side but totally worth the money, we tried variety of food being a team and loved most of it. This place has an excellent am ambiance.

The dishes i highly recommend is the peking duck, the coconut desert, ahi tuna starter - this were my favourites among the thing we ordered. The cocktails were also really good. The one i would not try again is the three way lobster.

I would go back here back 😊
240.name: sunitha suresh

241.review: It's a bit pricey, but good.
241.name: Thomas Toh

242.review: The decoration and atmosphere is amazing here .. it’s perfect for romantic dinner with the love of your life
242.name: Nazar Ajeely

243.review: Paid for a lot of money for bottle service, had to stand in the pouring rain for an hour. Staff is very rude in the night club area. The restaurant is recommended but do NOT waste your time on the club.
243.name: Landon Garner

244.review:
Bad experience!!!!!!!! I was millions times in this place they never asked for me my ID !!!! I Couldn’t get a alcohol drink because I didn’t have my ID with me . So all my friends got a drink and I’m the only one that didn’t get.
The server wasn’t nice didn’t smile 
I was at least 3 times in a month now I will never going to get this place again!
244.name: Selior Bitton

245.review: It's TAO...you know what to expect--food, cocktails and ambience.
245.name: Renny Itwaru

246.review: Ambience is nice, food is good and its a little on the expensive side but that's what you expect dining in Manhattan. They do a wonderful job in catering to large crowds particular for birthdays, engagement parties and regular corporate dinners. Just make sure you are on time for your reservation otherwise it will be a long wait.
246.name: Jah Savior

247.review: Reasonably tasty. Weird entrance kind of feels like an alley. Drinks were mediocre.
247.name: Nicole Sullivan

248.review: Amazing! Fun night on the town!
248.name: Inna V

249.review:
Delicious meal
The sea bass!! OMG! Divine.
249.name: Kristen DeLeo

250.review: Pleasant service, with beautiful ambiance. Music mix was good for easy listening.
250.name: Shanda Holt

251.review: What an amazing atmosphere! The food was delicious and the wait to eat was very short. The kitchen closes late at night and the service was great. Looking forward to going back soon.
251.name: Robert Mauceri

252.review: Great food and ambience,  pay for what you get
252.name: FRANK HERMIZ

253.review:
the place is very nice, the large status is like a show of its own. the whole thing is so beautiful, and the atmosphere is very dark, but music is very new (a bit of a contrast in my taste). 
2 issues - 
1. a bit pricey
2. they made a mistake and gave us food that we said in advance we are allergic to - we only got a small sorry, and that is all. be careful if you are allergic to anything. i would triple check anything i eat here!
253.name: Ido Achrak

254.review: Great place for dinner and drinks. Have decent vegetarian options.
254.name: Sonal Maheshwari

255.review: Ok just pick the right meal
255.name: NineAceEntRecords .

256.review: Great leave but second floor needs to be more ventilated
256.name: Loki Pehar

257.review: UNREAL. I have been to Tao in Vegas but this is a cut above. It is located underground and reminded me of the casino scene from Black Panther. Amazing service and the food is to die for. I would recommend ordering lots and then sharing with your pals. Cocktails were deadly and the coconut custard dessert was so delicious. Overall, one or my best meals in NYC.  Such a sexy vibe!
257.name: Taylor Bogle

258.review: This place was nice. I loved the atmosphere. I loved the look from inside and out. The service was good to for a 3 person group sitting in a lounge type area. The food however was just decent. I had the pad thai with chicken with a rose beer. Since I'm being honest it was NOT worth the $23. I've had better chicken pad thai from a hole in the wall that did not serve alcohol or even tables to sit at. This was as simple as it could have gotten. Noodles, tofu, mushrooms (if I could have them), chicken and raw bean sprouts.  No egg no veg no extra. It was nice for an experience but for sure nothing I'd go back to.
258.name: Steph Alexis

259.review: I’ll be honest - food is average, but way overpriced. Service is ok, nothing special. The extra stars are for good drinks and unique interior. There are many other places in NYC where you can have much tastier food and top notch service plus the view and less pricey.
259.name: Polina Jaskot

260.review: Went there a 3 week ago for my friend bday celebration. I have to say it was amazing the staff was friendly and professional. fast and easy service. Lets not forget  the ambience fabulous decor....will definitely be back 💖
260.name: Jermina James

261.review: Excellent place for dinner. Be sure to make a reservation. Great food
261.name: Santiago Samra

262.review: Beautiful decor. GOOD food. Good music. friendly and knowledgeable staff  There were  little things of annoyance. the waiter would foll our glasses with water even if we weren't drinking water. Also the wheelchair accessibility was not the best accommodation for this type of establishment.
262.name: Shamone Hackle

263.review: Place was beautiful and the food was great. in fact I ate with 3 other friends spend like $400 then went to the nightclub where we were told we couldn't come in unless we have a $600 tab.Who does that.  We were so disgusted and  disappointed.
263.name: MIA IndiaLuv

264.review: Upscale place, good food and great music!
264.name: Jonathan Chery

268.review: Fabulous establishment! Food, presentation, DJ, ambiance like somewhere in a movie. Had one of the best times ever of all my outings in NYC. Heads up though..those drink prices say NYC 😉 All was well worth it!! Will be back before the summer for another Lychee Martini and their short ribs. The venue is dessert 😎😊
268.name: Drew Mckenzie

272.review: Amazing fod with a great atmosphere
272.name: Gamer Two

274.review: Delicious food as always. Great cocktails
274.name: Mischa Cebo

275.review: Great spot, a bit noisy but awesome food
275.name: Zachria Zoom

276.review: Excellent food, prepared with with a lot of care and imagination. Great service.
276.name: Kutlay Ebiri

277.review: Food quality was on another level! I felt like I died and went to heaven. Loved every bite! Makes me question what I've been eating all these years!
277.name: Carmel Macklin

278.review: Service, food, and ambiance was great
278.name: Sheila Mesidor

279.review: Food and decor is on point. Fabulous experience
279.name: sonell nembhard

280.review: Hip spot (loud and crowded), but for good reason.  Hip usually means super-younger crowd -- but this isn't the case for Tao all the time.  Vibe is energizing and food and drinks are incredible. Reservations can be had on OpenTable with about a weeks notice (so not bad!)   It is pricey for sure!!
280.name: Brett Goffin

282.review: Great spot but needs to do more better with the security policies at the front door ,we had Rsvp prior before for 4 people & we still had to wait nearly an hour outside in the freezing cold while we watch security let their friends in that just arrived ,so I would say improve the entrance situation then it would be 5 ⭐
282.name: SUPA TURBOLOCITY

283.review: I loved the food and the atmosphere. The workers had bad attitudes from the lady in the rest room to the woman at the door & the server. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go to this location but I would recommend for people to go to the up town Tao or others locations. The woman were really rude.
283.name: Kickin It With IV

284.review: NYC experience at its best. Yeah, it's a bit touristic, but the food is great(not perfect, but def great) the decor is out of this world, the service is good, and the atmosphere is perfect if you're looking for good vibes, music to go with your meal. It's on the pricier side, but IMO worth it.
284.name: Jacques Cline

285.review: Came with friends, and enjoyed every second!!!
285.name: Mimi Macklin

286.review: One of my fav restaurants in the city ❤️
286.name: Ana Aladashvili

288.review: Amazing food and ambiance. Highly recommend it.
288.name: Tilak Jani

289.review: Tasty food, good cocktails, but very slow and disinterested service. Seems like a place more interested in creating a vibe than in being genuine.
289.name: Steve Welgoss

290.review: Wooow great atmosphere, delicious food!! Try the dumples, it's delicious!!!
290.name: Nariman Loulou

292.review: The prices for drinks are insane. By far the biggest rip off. The darn space is below grade yet they charge as if it's the corner of 57th & Madison.
292.name: The giant diamond Salmon

293.review: Love the Hot n Sour soup and lo mein noodles
293.name: moh iqbal

294.review: It was okay. I went here on a Saturday night and the ambience is absolutly beautiful but the service isn't as great as I hoped for. We brought our friends from another country here and they were dissapointed on the service as well...
294.name: DeMaris Gonzalez

295.review: Huge fan. Food and atmosphere. Might be little loud for some people.
295.name: Dominick Withanachchi

296.review: Amazing place, food was excellent. High energy. Dirty bathroom
296.name: Noel Damico

297.review: Good cuisine and atmosphere. A little noisy. Better to make reservation.
297.name: Anna G

298.review: Tao is absolutely amazing, from atmosphere to service to delicious food.
298.name: maria lova

300.review: I loved the sweet there , food is average . Need reservation . Services need improvement . Cosy
300.name: Mahawi Awad

301.review: Love it, went here for a birthday dinner. It has a good menu, the pad thai js good and filling
301.name: Tristan King

302.review: 9th time here and had to write a review... The Chilean Seabass was AMAZZZZZZING!
302.name: Jeffrey Mayes

303.review: The food taste like hell don’t even call Japanese
303.name: ムサシムシキング

304.review: My favorite New York spot when family and friends visit. Amazing atmosphere and food!
304.name: Sofia Mayer

305.review: Great as always. Service first rate.
305.name: Mauricia O'Kieffe

306.review: Nice spot ❤️ the food was good and nice place to take pictures.
306.name: Danielle Baskerville

307.review: Amazing experience, best chinese i ever ate in my life
307.name: Mark DeStafano

308.review: Very cool place. Way too loud music.. Don't eat at the lounge area, its very uncomfortable and you cant talk to the person next to you because of the music. The food was good. Especially the dessert. Don't liked that they asked to hold my credit card as we where eating.  It was a cool experience but i wont go there again to eat in the lounge area.. Maybe in the main dining area.
308.name: Haukur V. Jonsson

309.review: We eat out almost every meal and and have been to many restaurants around the world. I can honestly say this was the biggest rip off I have ever experienced.  $350 with tip for noodles and rice dishes for 4 , one drink each and 1 desert to share.  The atmosphere is very interesting but the Downtown restaurant is feeling a bit rundown. The service was average at best. Save your money.
309.name: Mark Roberts

310.review: Love the decor, atmosphere and crowd.  Food and drinks are on the pricey side, but excellent and worth the money, so a good value.  Recommend for anyone looking for a great meal, to a good party scene.
310.name: Thomas Bernard

311.review: Great food, super attentive service yet a bit expensive, but I suppose that is to be expected at restaurants like this one
311.name: Pablo Ruiz

312.review: Great Food, atmosphere, service and music was on point!
312.name: Shay Steele

313.review: I had a beautiful time my daughter's 19th birthday
313.name: SENCI DON

314.review:
Tonight was my 40th!! Gabriel was one of the most friendliest bartenders I’ve met.... the drinks he made us were outstanding! The boa buns were amazing! And the rock shrimp lettuce wraps were delish!!   

Thanks Gabriel for the great experience!
314.name: michael belnome

315.review: I really love this place, but 3 stars due to the fact that reservations are never on Time, you always need to wait an additional 30mins- 1 to be seated. aside from that , this place is awesome and food is delicious never disappoints.
315.name: Joey torres

316.review: This place has great food and professional service.
316.name: Max Aronov
