317.review: For the club: I like the venue and crowd is not bad for a lounge. But the DJ is really bad. I've only been there twice though, so could have just been unlucky with the DJ.
317.name: Salah Eldin Elprince

318.review: Lobster was over cooked. Food was a bit too pricey. Won't be back
318.name: Stop Dreaming

319.review: Very impressive food, cocktails and ambiance
319.name: c vega

321.review:
First thing you notice about this restaurant is its design - it is very high-end and impressive and sets the good type of atmosphere. 

The service is pretty good, the waiters being very professional and helpful. The food itself is also pretty good, but isn't something outstanding. The prices are fair, but are definitely not cheap.

If you're looking for a highly stylish restaurant with good food and prices that aren't too expensive - this would be a decent choice.
321.name: Eyal Roth

323.review: TERRIBLE SERVICE, security doesn’t know what they’re doing. Claimed my ID WAS FAKE BUT IM 24!!! Would not alow me to get in even if i had my passport too. This was security in restaurant entrance to the club on feb 5th 11pm. I am extremely disappointed DO NOT COME HERE DONT WASTE YOUR TIME!!!!
323.name: Jezabel G

324.review:
The food was incredible, especially the Mongolia Beef which was so juicy and well seasoned. 
The biggest flaw of Tao is the space itself, which is way way overcrowded for an elite restaurant. 
The tables were so cramped together without any separation that it felt more like a Jewish wedding, and less like a place where you would go for an intimate date.
If you do decide to go, my advice is to ask for seating at the lobby, which is much nicer.
324.name: Omer Rosen

325.review: This place is like a dance club inside. I sat at the sushi bar. The black rice with seafood was so good. The service was great and the crowd was entertaining. Everyone was having a good time.
325.name: Melanie Sisco

326.review: The food is fantastic and the atmosphere is out of this world (you have to walk through a labyrinth, basically, to get to the actual restaurant), but your wallet will pay the price.
326.name: Dylan Martin

327.review: Horrible costumer service, manager Christian was super rude and racist. Will not come back.
327.name: Anastasia Balagurova

328.review: one of my favorite places in NYC!  love the atmosphere, food, drinks, and service! we sat at the sushi bar because we didnt have reservations but it was still an awesome time!
328.name: Veronica Rogala

331.review: Little over priced for what you eat. Service slow at tables
331.name: Paul luther

332.review: Favorite Tao in the city just the whole vibe is amazing
332.name: Lwando Ndimeni

333.review: I was very impressed with this place. I have been to the one in Los Angeles so that is the reason for going just to see the difference. Great place with a great wait staff. the drinks were amazing and the food was delicious as expected . Try the Pad Thai it is worth the visit.
333.name: Lee Mckee

334.review:
Very cool place .
Not sure about music choice .
Food just great !!
334.name: Larisa Shneyderov

335.review: Very nice and the food, drinks and service was wonderful
335.name: Rey Cruz

336.review: Trendy af and food is phenomenal! One of my fav spots
336.name: Navneet Singh

338.review: This place is massive but still has a cozy loungy vibe. Food and drinks are amazing. Great place to meet up with friends for dinner & drinks before going out or just stay at the nightclub there.
338.name: Jennifer DeLatte

339.review: Food and atmosphere is amazing here. Just wish the service could be a smidge better and the waiting period isn’t as long as it normally is. It’s pricey, but the environment is worth it.
339.name: Selena Sampaio

340.review: The food is excellent.  The wait staff at the table is very good.  They are very bad at keeping to reservation times.  Do not be surprised if they are 30mins to an hour late seating you.
340.name: Mark Ramsey

341.review: Nice venue, interior design was enjoyable. Very relaxed adult type atmosphere. Highly recommend. Food is great! $$$ be ready to spend!
341.name: Mr. Vinncredible V. Dais

342.review: 3rd time here and as usual, great food and experience
342.name: Dennis Roger

343.review:
I had heard so much about this place, thought restaurant week will be the right opportunity to try it out. Oh was it a let down! 
Lets be clear about one thing, this is not a fine dining restaurant, sir no sir. There is nothing fine about dining here. Neither the food, nor the ambience nor the service. The l reason I still gave it double stars is because of the decor and the sheer size of this place. Such gigantic restaurants are scarce in New York, and yet somehow they manage to cramp it up with too many tables. They have a low light set up , and the guests keep flashing cameras every minute to take pictures,  makes it feel more like times square than an upscale restaurant. Even the music was too loud to hold a  conversation over dinner. 
The food was mediocre at best, I had the hot and sour soup for appetizer which was all right. My husband got vegetables spring rolls, which were also ok, we have had much better.  For entree we both ordered pad thai, which I know is supposed to be slightly sweet, but this was so sweet we really didn't want any deserts afterward. The desert however was the saving grace of our meal, the chocolate cake with ice cream was a good end to a very mediocre evening.
343.name: Bhavya Sharma

344.review: Good food. Good service. Great environment.
344.name: Jetendra Dublish

345.review: Vast seating, great statues of Buddhist Spiritual figures, tasty food, lemon grass creambule was very tasty. Service is too fast, some food items were not hot when served?
345.name: Arvind Jindia

346.review: We only went for drinks because it was local and they were insanely overpriced and (seemingly) weak. $19 for a Bacardi and coke?! Their cocktail list is limited and even when asked to make another standard cocktail it tasted like cordial. Atmosphere was ok...full of posers.
346.name: Cassie Wood

347.review: If you like to wait two hours or more - despite having a reservation - this is the place for you. Location is very nice but the staff is unfriendly and has an attitude... We decided to leave after waiting for nearly 3 hours and seeing table after table being given away, even though the staff told us that we get the very next table and the current guests are already eating dessert and will pay soon. I have the feeling that they actively lied to us in order to keep us waiting at the bar instead of just telling the truth about the waiting time. Disappointing - especially for the high price tag. NYC has much better to offer.
347.name: Tillmann Felippi

348.review: Gorgeous space, professional and friendly staff. Food was ok.
348.name: Nina F.

351.review: Fantastic place! Food is great and service was excellent.
351.name: Abu Sufian

353.review: Great atmosphere, awesome drinks,food is overated.
353.name: Tierra Dailey

354.review: Went for a private company party and it was great. The staff was extremely attentive.
354.name: Albert Flecha

355.review: Food was decent- i didnt love my mral but liked my friend's meal. I had salmon and the fried noodle with meat. More mushrooms thab actual meat. And the salmon was just ok. Ambience is great but seating is a bit crowded. We had a great time overall due to the random strangers in the table next to us that we started talking to...since we were both practically at the same table!
355.name: Kemi Owoseni

356.review: Beautiful ambience, good music and absolutely delicious food, drinks are on the expensive side, the most basic margarita at whooping 23 dollars, it might be worth it if the ingredients were fresh, just keep that in mind when ordering drinks, but the food quity and flavors definitely makes the visit a must when in NYC!
356.name: adal

357.review: This place is gorgeous. What a huge space, and the decor is breath taking, I love the Buddah's. The food is really amazing. I went during restaurant week with friends, so our 3 course meal was very affordable, however I believe meal and drinks can get a bit pricey here during other times. Either way, the visit is worth it for the experience.
357.name: Damaris Ceren

358.review: TAO is absolutely stunning. Their interior decoration is amazingly beautiful. It is recommended you get a reservation and arrive early for it. While you wait to be seated they send you to their bar area and as well as their dining area it’s beautiful. Their drinks are delicious but a little too pricey. I went with a group of friends for my friends birthday. Their food was absolutely delicious and their dessert was mouth watering. Again a bit pricey but definitely a spot to go for a dinner date or special occasion. Definitely will try and visit again soon.
358.name: Victoria Semizo

359.review: my favorite sushi/asian restaurant in the city..
359.name: brooke marciano

360.review: Great service delicious food and drinks !
360.name: Genelle Hamilton

361.review: I would give this place more than 5*! From the staff to the ambience to the variety in the menu!!! Was awestruck! Kudos to the designer for the contoured seating arrangement! I would love to go again and again!
361.name: Amishi Desai

362.review: Great place. Server was extremely nice, love the ambiance and the food was to die for. Bartender was very kind when were finally seated everything went smooth. Hence the five star. Definitely one my favorite spots
362.name: Jian Huang

363.review: Great place good food no wait
363.name: Michael Kralick

364.review:
This is an amazing place to dine out for any special occasion. A little pricey but totally worth it! Make sure you book a table in advance before going as the wait times can be really long. We booked a table beforehand but we were late, they were really nice to offer us a table even then. 
The food is delicious, mesmerising ambience. Overall a great experience! The Buddha statue in the middle of the restaurant gives a lot of character to the place.
364.name: Komal Kubsad

365.review: Food was great. Wonderful ambiance with music.
365.name: Lourdes Diaz

366.review: Apparently not affiliated with the one in Shanghai. Upscale club type thing beside Google.
366.name: Brandon Wang

367.review: Love the ambiance and the food is delicious!
367.name: K Rhooms

368.review: Staff was nice, food was fresh and nicely prepared
368.name: Marc Pio

369.review: Great ambience, love their bar! Ruby red dragon cocktail is a must must try!!
369.name: Suma Z

370.review: Been coming here for years. Never disappointed. If you love filet mignon, this is the place to order it raw.
370.name: Master Wong

374.review: TAO is a nice place, very beautiful and tranquil decor. Our drinks were sooo tasty, our waitress was very sweet and efficient too. We went to TAO on Saturday around 9 pm, the place was busy with lots of beautiful , Happy people who were having fun and enjoying themselves. Great vibes!!! Will definitely be back when I am in NYC !
374.name: Kseniya Tsoi

375.review: Great experience. Bring a well-stocked wallet but for a one-off or special occasion this place does the trick. We had maybe 12 dishes between our group and every single one was excellent (the pad Thai in particular was one of the best I’ve ever had). Cocktail menu is wide-ranging and the space itself is enormous and very slick.
375.name: Ross Pennington

376.review: The first thing you notice is the ambience. Great music, good vibes, very nice setting! For the visuals, I would give 5 stars. The food was pretty good, not outstanding though. Also pricey, you're definitely paying for the  looks. Our server was awesome, made me & my group of friends feel very welcome! I will definitely be visiting again!
376.name: Tiara H

377.review: 24th birthday. Great experience and thoughtful waitress. I had the glazed salmon. I personally don't feel like the aviso vinaigrette matches with the salmom though. Although the fish was cooked beautifully.
377.name: Lisa Wu

378.review: Great food the night club is no provocateur. But youll be sure not to leave alone
378.name: pasha heart

379.review: This restaurant is a must for me and my friends. A trip to New York is not complete if we don't eat at TAO. What makes it special for us, besides the obvious things, good food, atmosphere, friendly and competent staff, is the fact that has been consistently like that for ages. It has been the same since when I can remember. I certainly recommend a visit.
379.name: Fabrizio Morelli

380.review: The service here is excellent. The vibes are different from most Asian restaurants in the city. Pricey and worthy.
380.name: Miguel Galeano

381.review:
The restaurant is huge and is very nicely decorated. The food was disappointing for the price.
Crispy Thai pork was fine. Sirloin was completely dry. Pad Thai was dry too.
381.name: Andrey Klinger

382.review: Too good.  Pricey. But good food. Good decor. Good service.
382.name: rajkumar PARDASANI

383.review: Lol what even is this place. I will admit that I have never had the food here, and that’s because I can’t bring myself to pay out the butt for the “pan-Asian” food here. I’ve had a cocktail here celebrating a coworker’s birthday, and it was fine, but it also took over $20 out of my pocket, and that was for just one drink. 388.review: I have to say this is one of the most beautiful restaurants I have been to. That being said, I truly wished the service could have been as good or better than the decor. My boyfriend took me here last year to celebrate our 1 yr and 6 month anniversary, it also conveniently fell during restaurant week! I was in awe as soon as we entered, however that quickly went away when it came time for us to eat. We sat on the seats they had that were in the middle of the staircase. As soon as our waitress came I felt this awful negative vibe from her. She acted extremely pretentious and to make it worse gave me the NASTIEST attitude for asking questions about the menu. She even talked down at me as if I was a child. I was seriously contemplating getting up and leaving but I refused to let her ruin my special night with my sweet man. Now the food is what led me to give the extra star in the review. I had the Temple Salad, Mongolian Beef, and Warm Chocolate Cake. The Mongolian Beef TRULY was the showstopper for me. The flavors were incredible and the meat melted in my mouth. My mouth is watering as I write this. Yes, it's that good. My boyfriend got the Vegetable Spring Roll, Chicken Pad Thai, and the Fruit with Sorbet. He enjoyed his meal as well. Overall the food left me feeling on top of the world, but remembering the service I experienced brought me back to reality, left too much of a bad taste in my mouth, and unfortunately outweighed the beauty of the food and decor. Try to hire more hospitable waitresses so others don't share the same experience I had.
388.name: Beatrice Ross

389.review:
This is the first restaurant in NYC I felt unwelcome as soon as I checked in , informed the receptionist that my company can’t attend this dinner , immediately I told to waited in sushi bar, after I asked other receptionist should I get a seat cause I made reservations already , then I finally seated but no menu to bring on my table , I waited almost 13 min then my waitresses finally came , she had a smile , warm & welcome, totally different attitude compare the front desk! But still gave me the wrong drink , but she did changed it afterward !
The second waitress came after my main course served , she was the same attitude just like other the pretty girl in front desk!
Only the manager more concerned the performance over all! 
Because this is the first day of restaurant week, also my first try out too, I ordered from the special restaurant week menu , more worst , soup too salty & sour , Main course so so , the dessert banana pudding too creamy too fat , 2 spoons in mouth I lost appetite, right away I miss my favor place in NYC, regret to get out my comfort zone , at 7 pm this restaurant start filled up more people , the noice much worst than dining in McDonald, lol.. the only place you can hide be peaceful enjoyable is the bathroom chair ! 
The best place in this restaurant in the bathroom, quiet , nice & clean , the lady did a great job also helped to take some pics made my day & dinner more warmer & pleasant, If u like more fine , classy & intimate dinner, more higher quality cooking , please go to else where , this is not your shoe , may be good for big party people , not picky for high quality food , see the pic below:
389.name: Milorad Vukovich

540.review:
Let me just  start by saying, what a gorgeous place!  I went for dinner on a Wednesday night.  We were a group of 10 that were seated at two separate tables by one another. There were only 4 people sitting at my table. We ordered 3 appetizers and then our entrees. Appetizers came out fast. The Edamame and Pork dumplings were delicious. After about a half hour, all the entrees came except for mine. The waitress said, "no worries, it'll be out soon". I waited another half hour, still nothing. Waitress comes back and says, "you still haven't gotten your order? Let me run to the kitchen to see what's going on". Half hour later, still nothing. At this point, everyone finished their food, I was cranky, and absolutely famished from only having breakfast that day. When the waitress finally comes back she sees that I still don't have my food. She disappears and I never see  again. She happens to stop by our table while I was in the restroom and tells my fiance that my food went to a different table. Then proceeds to say "no worries, I'll just take it off your bill". WHAT??? So I just sat here for two hours for NOTHING. Why not just bring my order? 
Because we were there celebrating my fiance, I decided not to make a big deal about it, not ruin his night. But I am very disappointed in this place. I really wanted to like it. But where is the service???
540.name: Ashley Souffront

541.review: Great place for dinner and great atmosphere
541.name: Tal Adler

543.review: Billed me 4x the amount of my bill!!!!!!!! Took my money and won’t call or email me back!!!! I have been chasing everyday for over a week. All the way from the UK.  And don’t even bother with the club....
