545.name: Barak Nachmias

546.review: Good food, beautiful ambiance very pricey
546.name: jean Martin

547.review: Amazing food great service and a good environment
547.name: Daniel Torres

548.review: Awesome ambience great music great food
548.name: Nadia Boltz

549.review: This rating is because of poor service and attitude from the server. Being a vegetarian, I asked for meatless recommendations. One turned out to have fish sauce. No problem, asked for a substitute. When the bill came I was charged for both items. Pointed this out and it took him 20 minutes to get the correct bill, and many more minutes to charge it. Very disappointing!
549.name: Amar Joshi

551.review: Beautiful woman, fashionable men and great food.
551.name: Tony Assoon

552.review: I have no words this is just excellent
552.name: norberto rozon

553.review:
Bouncer's idea of letting everyone know it was time to move to the other floor was smacking the bottom of your drink and spilling it all over you. A single napkin he brought before promptly hauling ass was supposed to be penance and "please don't get me fired." So one goes downstairs. And is promptly informed by another bouncer that one cannot lean against the back of some couches. Before seconds later watching some girls do it at the exact same spot, which he's 111.7% cool with. And the bartenders are a cross between retarded monkeys and . . . just plain retarded.

Should you come here? No.
553.name: Tommy McDaniel

554.review: Wonderfully designed, feels like you're in a movie. Kill Bill perhaps? However, food is expensive and very plain and unauthentic. Small portions too. Paid 40 bucks in total for something I'd get at a mall stand for 4. The place is also very dark and loud so you can't really talk or see your friends well. I'd recommend this place to anyone who doesn't really know Asian food and has extra money, and who doesn't mind loud music, because it is quite beautiful!
554.name: Arbel Vigodny

555.review: Wow, this place is hot, the food is good, the amount of hot chicks is amazing.
555.name: War Ninja

556.review: Way too expensive. The food is just average, and it is not authentic. The environment is noisy.
556.name: Henry Hu

557.review:
Girlfriend took me for my birthday last night and I was mostly blown away.

We did the NYC restaurant week menu + a couple of items off the regular menu.

Drinks: I had the 5 spice Manhatten. Really good flavor. Not sure it was worth $19, but it was damn good.

Appetizers: 
Crispy rice with tuna: probably my favorite dish of the night. Nice crunch and the tuna had just the right amount of spice. Definitely some of the freshest tuna I've had.

Veggie egg rolls: perfectly crispy and really tasty

Tempura eggplant: another home run

Main courses:
Sushi: again really fresh fish, really tasty

Thai chicken: bright flavors, perfectly cooked. Awesome dish

BBQ duck fried rice: awesome dish with a decent amount of duck and fresh veggies. Really good flavors

Desert:
Molten chocolate cake: decadent - cake was moist, chocolate inside flowed out after the first bite mixing with the vanilla ice cream that was on top of some kind of chocolate cookie crumble/dust. Really liked this

Fruit sorbet: not my favorite, but my girlfriend said it was fine, but wishes she got a different desert instead. This was the only disappointing part of the meal

Service was good. Our waitress was perfectly attentive.

Overall, a really amazing birthday dinner. The prices are the only thing that might keep me from going back except for very special occasions
557.name: Dan Fleischl

558.review: Food was yummy, dessert to die for. Ambiance is amazing as well
558.name: Radhika Sharma

559.review: Tao is a great place to celebrate a special birthday or an occasion. The ambiance is perfect and the space is expansive. It feels very opulent and the that is what makes it all worth it. In terms of the food and the dining prices, however, it is overpriced and the food is nothing to write home about so if you go for that, you will be disappointed. It gets booked up pretty quickly so make sure you book in advance or you'll have to wait a while to find a seat, especially on the weekends. The staff are friendly enough, but they tend to come off as a bit too nonchalant.
559.name: Nana Boateng

560.review:
Ok the food is good BUT, service was horrible. I can’t explain my experience. I booked a table for 3 people on a Friday night at 10:30 pm. Although I arrived 10 minutes earlier, I still had to wait an HOUR AND 45 minutes to fightttt for a table. 
Many will ask why I waited that long I could have just left, well they kept telling me 10 more minutes each time till t added up to 1:45 minutes. There were more than 10 groups of people, minimum of 3 people each group that were told they had a reservation and were waiting as well.
I talked to the manager and had to fight for a table but it was an embarrassment. I had my friends visiting from abroad and wanted to take them somewhere nice and they ended up waiting 1 hour and 45 minutes. I did not enjoy the food after I only ate because I was hungry and STANDING for an hour and 45 minutes. 
There are a million restaurants in New York that can easily put Tao on the side. Tao is overrated and VERY Cliche it doesn’t make sense that they think they are something outstanding for people to wait for their reservations for 1 hour and 45 minutes. 
And I could have waited longer like the other people if I didn’t have to keep asking for my table.
560.name: Jana Chams

561.review:
Could have swore I rated this place before. Somehow it fell off the face of the (google) Earth.

When you step into Tao, it's like they invaded a Buddhist-Temple and made a Restaurant/Bar to feed and entertain an army of socialites.

 It's big - Real big! The Bar is nice with proper drinks. The dining area, enough for GOOGLE to throw a Corporate Rave. Food is typically good.

Great for dinner/pregame and plan B.
Stay away from the trap around the corner. Not worth it.

The food is obviously very Asian in a good way. Priced fairly. What you would expect from a Hotel Restaurant. Open late. Great for entertaining big parties.
561.name: James Andersonn

562.review: This is a beautiful place with great drink and ambiance no doubt! Unfortunately we had a 10:30 reservation for a birthday and still had to wait 1.5 hours to be seated. For our inconvenience we were given a free drink ticket. Many people in my group ordered the coconut shrimp, I had a special shrimp dish with salt and pepper, Lightly fried , with a delicious sauce on the Side. I didn’t like that the head was attached to my shrimp, and my group didn’t care for the peanut sauce that came with their coconut shrimp. The lomein with pork was delicious! The Shanghai fried rice was bland and instead of the egg being cooked into the rice, it’s fried and shaped into a bowl to hold the rice. I love tao for its ambiance but the wait time I experienced this visit along with mediocre food left a bad taste in my mouth.
562.name: Tiffany Oglesby

563.review: Excellent food, and comfortable to eat by yourself at the sushi bar. Portions were large, so I ended up ordering a bit too much. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Prices are somewhat steep, but can be justified.
563.name: Xander Groesbeek

564.review: You have got to go here.
564.name: Benjamin Ivey

565.review: We went here for my birthday. The waiters are annoying. They act like they hate their life. The ambient light is insufficient, I could barely see what I ate. Nothing special with the food. Portions are relatively small. I wish we went elsewhere.
565.name: Canberk Suat Gurel

566.review: Come for the atmosphere, stay for the food and drinks. The service is also excellent. Had a work dinner there and were well treated. A warning that it is not the most accessible as there is a set of stairs from street down to the restaurant.
566.name: Chiung-Yin Chung

567.review: Delicious sushi and sashimi. Popping nightclub! The DJs are dope!
567.name: Deonia Jolie

568.review: tao is more on the pricey side but if you're looking to impress your date or friends this is the place to go to. The interior designing is on a different level and sexy. Large Thai sculptures with really cool lighting, signature cocktails and good food.
568.name: Schayan Ashouri

570.review: Out of the 4 in the United States, this is my favorite Tao location.  I absolutely love their decor and although the LA location looks very similar, it just doesn't have the same vibe.  Otherwise, the food is the same, always outstanding.  The only thing I wish about this location is that they had the chocolate parfait, like they do in Vegas.   For some odd reason only Vegas has this most amazing dessert.
570.name: Joshua Alpert

572.review: Cool event space.  I was there as a photographer for the opening night cast party for the Broadway show of Mean Girls.  Very hip.
572.name: Chad Kraus

574.review:
I cannot in good faith rate Tao any higher than one star. Tao was completely unprofessional and I'll explain why in detail. Around noon, I had made a reservation over the phone to dine at Tao at 9pm that same evening. I arrived 15 minutes early and confirmed my 9pm reservation with the reception. They never called me for my table. I checked in with them 15 minutes after my reservation time, at which point the table was not ready.  I checked in after another 15 minutes, and my table still wasn't ready. When I told the receptionist that I had a 9pm reservation and I had been waiting for half an hour, she blew me off saying my table would be ready soon; she then proceeded to speak with two other parties despite the fact that I was speaking with her first. I got a hold of another employee who was working nearby, who spoke with the receptionist on my behalf. I was then taken to the dining hall, and 45 minutes after my reservation finally seated somewhere roughly in the middle of the hall. The table was small, maybe 4 feet wide and 2 feet deep, but the bigger problem was how low the (uncomfortable) seats were to the floor. I may as well have been sitting on the floor! I was unhappy, and my date was unhappy,  and the second the waiter arrived I was going to demand a different, better table, as I could clearly see that other guests did not have to suffer the same inconvenience I did...but the waiter never came. I waited another 15 minutes, and the waiter never showed up! By this point, an hour after the reservation time, we were both completely fed up with Tao. We walked out of the dining hall to complain to a manager,  whose unacceptable resolution was that I wait another 15-30 minutes for new table. When I replied "then we'll go somewhere else" the manager suddenly stated that I could, in fact, be seated right away, which I perceived as deceptive. Given all the problems and grief Tao had given me in the last hour, and that it was getting late (even Manhattan restaurants start to close after 10pm), I left Tao. My date and I then walked to a nearby fine restaurant (which I have yet to review) without any reservations. I'll have you know that we were treated better there without reservations than we were at Tao with reservations! It is for this reason that I rate Tao 1 star.

Anyway, let me describe some other details. Tao has a coatcheck at the entrance, which is nice. The two employees manning the coatcheck were friendly and quick to smile. The front area was immaculately clean, while the bar and dining area were moderately clean. The bar area was crowded and loud, but there is a nearby area, just as loud and crowded, with comfortable couch seating when available. The dining hall decoration is ornate and on a slope, which makes the already somewhat high ceiling look even higher. I have a mixed opinion of the dining hall because while much of the seating is nicer, mine was not; I would think the better seats would be given to those holding reservations and to regulars. I already described my generally low opinion of the reception staff and my unpleasant interaction with management. I never tried the food, so I cannot evaluate it. All in all, I do not intend to return to Tao, nor would I recommend it due to the complete lack of professionalism I was shown on my first visit.
574.name: David Thompson

575.review: Have a date? Bring them here. Really good vibes.
575.name: Andrew Jester

576.review: Danielle was my server and she was amazing. Beautiful ambiance
576.name: Eleoya Simpson-Clarke

577.review: Cool place. A really good vibe. The staff did an awesome job of handling so many hungry people in a calm and collected way. Would definitely go again if the prices were more reflective of the quality of food - wouldn't say it was bad food but totally not worth the a la carte prices. We got a restaurant week deal so we didn't really feel too bad about it. The consensus among my wife and me was that the salmon she ordered was inedible. We didn't want to make a big deal about if though because everything else was nice and the experience was worth it. I would definitely recommend going here, but avoid dishes that are easy to mess up if the restaurant is busy.
577.name: Chris Tams

578.review: Great Food, Great Ambience, Excellent Service
578.name: Reaktion Sound

579.review: Good food, good drinks, but incredibly expensive. Mostly worth it, though I don't know if I would go there again.
579.name: Ken F

580.review: The food is simple and not too pricey. The drinks - strong and expensive! I don't mind them too much! Better then the other location.
580.name: Jared Wiseman

581.review: The food, the ambience, our waiter, absolutely everything was amazing. If you go please try the chicken lollipops .. we ordered two rounds and I swear the second batch was even better
581.name: Genesis Rivas

582.review: Everything was good. And the service was great
582.name: Alice Ronke

583.review: Highly recommend. Great service. Good food. Zero complaints.
583.name: Michael Gomez

584.review: Great atmosphere, fine dining and music and drinks. Nice and the food was good
584.name: Queene Payne

585.review: My only complain on the whole visit, is that if you are presenting chopsticks in the table, I expect the food to be cut in the kitchen, because you are supposed to be able to use only the chopsticks to eat your plate, yet my meat was not cut, but I am being picky though, more people than not, will not notice, and to be fair, in other visits to other tao's the dish was completely chop sticks friendly.
585.name: Manuel Nunez

586.review: Im vegan....so i only eat the cauliflower in sweet and sour sauce and some sprouts ...the ambience is very date night because Its very dark in there...the server kept rushing us and stood over me as i was looking over the menu to order ....tf?!!
586.name: kim thomas

587.review: Great food, great people and top tier service. These guys definitely know what they are doing. And the club is probably one of the best in the city right now.
587.name: David Janashvili

588.review: Today was such a great Night!!!  Excellent service Excellent Food Definitely a great experience
588.name: KATHY JIMENEZ

589.review: Great place albeit a bit pricey. A great experience!!
589.name: Endri Kasapi

590.review: I can’t wait for you guys to do Taos restaurant to also be in Miami Florida Rome Italy and London uk for those three locations thank you guys so much soon 😉👍🇮🇹🇬🇧🇺🇸
590.name: Matthew Elmakias

591.review: Look, the decor here is surreal and the service can be attentive. If it's not, you can ask for another waiter and it's all good. To my surprise the apps and main course were Ok. My group of 7 had oysters, chicken satay, edamame, and dumplings. Nothing amazing. For the main course I had the banana leaf sea bass. It was good, but portions of it lacked flavor. The fish was not consistent through all its parts. But the saving grave and winner - the desserts. We got everything and it was all unique in terms of flavor, appearance and texture. I think you can skip everything and just  come for desserts. I may plan that some day.
591.name: Samir Patel

592.review:
Place is absolutely amazing.  The food is over the top , we had the 93 dollar steak, lettuce shrimp cups, Peking duck, lobster egg roll, and the best item was a spicy cauliflower. The decor is just perfect with a big beautiful buddha. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.  I don't think the price was bad. $550 for everything.  Not cheap, but worth it.
#adamnotis #maybillmelgar #power
592.name: Adam Notis

594.review: Excellent food quality, atmosphere, and service! Will definitely try to go back ASAP
594.name: Ben Summers

595.review: Vegetable udon and fried rice tuna (replaced tuna with veggies) we're extremely yummy. Must try.
595.name: Anupama Prakash

596.review: Weakest club in nyc. Empty. Security is paranoid for nothing and the drinks are horrible. Never again.
596.name: Janina Suero

597.review: The beautiful design was a jaw dropper when I walked into the dining room. The food was flavorful, beyond my expectations. The presentation of the black rice was nice and again the taste was fresh and did not disappoint. Great service too
597.name: Maria Orlova

598.review: Myself and two good friends celebrated Mothers Day at Tao's. We had a waiter that misunderstood we do not eat pork. One couple ordered a dish substituting pork for chicken or so they thought. Long story short they ended up consuming swine (pork). Blake (Manager) was outstanding took care of the bill apologized for the mishap & all was well. Then Adam (Manager) contacted me after I responded to an email from Tao's, via phone Adam stating how we can return to Tao's as their guest & be comp. After receiving the full Tao's experience (which was great). They gave us a bill. The worst restaurant ever. Adam lied & deceived us. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to any.
598.name: BiosTwoElevenEnt .

599.review: Great decors and ambiance. The status with animation is amazing and the place is worth visiting. The music was so loud we couldn't hear each other or the waiter and it was a bit expensive for the quality. Still recommend as it's worth visiting the place and living the experience.
599.name: Maël Sicard-Cras

600.review:
Food was not good, staff was pushy, and the whole thing was extremely expensive - we paid 90 dollars for 1 beer, the crispy tuna (not good
- only tastes like mayonnaise), the temple salad (not good either) and fried rice. 

I would not waste another night in NYC in this restaurant even if the place looks nice
600.name: Léa Francis

601.review: NICE REST , BEAUTIFUL, I LOVE IT😍
601.name: Tamara Mieses

602.review:
The ambience is phenomenal. The drinks are alright. The food is good but for the price it could be better. The crispy pork buns were really tasty. The chilli chicken was not chilli enough. The Pad Thai was drenched in honey. The vegetable dumplings were so-so.
The dessert was absolutely amazing!! It was a warm chocolate cake. 
However it is worth a try for the ambience and the dessert!!
602.name: Meg A Loud

603.review: Great spot but I prefer uptown.
603.name: Genevieve Alsman

604.review: Fake Asian food was pretty good.
604.name: Jzrocket205

605.review: I FOUND MY NEW FAV RESTAURANT IN NYC!  The decors and ambiance is second to none.  I must say it is worth visiting.  To my expectations the food was the a flavorful and on point.  They do need to change the loud music, if I needed a club I would go next door.  It was a bit expensive but you do get what you pay for.
605.name: Regan Blue

606.review: Not bad, not my vibe exactly
606.name: Alan Brown

609.review: Overpriced and the food wasn’t great, but the atmosphere is nice.
609.name: Allison H

610.review: I had a good time, but the food and the staff was kind of “meh” , don’t get me wrong it neatly arranged and well organized but for me  I wouldn’t go here again
610.name: Green Light Switch

611.review:
Dined here today. Ordered the thai seafood dumplings (soup), lobster roll, lobster 3 ways,  and snapper breaded n fried.   when the soup was served  I realized it had mushrooms, which I'm allergic to so the server promptly removed it, but nothing was offered in it's place.   The lobster roll was delicious.  The snapper was huge n crisply fried but very bland ; the server initially served my fish to another guest😱.  He seemed confused because twice he misserved the order.  My partner didn't enjoy the lobster 3 way n left most if it on the plate.  The host did ask if everything was ok so I mentioned that the breaded onions that was served with the fish  were overly salty and he responded Again! Assuming that I was asking him to remove the plate.  Oh I had the lychee martini too that was delish!!
Will I dine  here again, highly unlikely.  The ambience was great though but when I go out to eat I expect to  fully enjoy the meal.
611.name: Carlene Lawrence

613.review: It's very fancy place. Their food was good but expensive. The decorations was really beautiful.
613.name: Hossein Talebinezhad

614.review:
Great place. Food cold & not so good
But good place to experience
614.name: Lisa Hewitt

615.review: Not much to say for TAO
615.name: Tahsin Uyar

616.review: 8 adults went...we could hardly  sit and read our menu because our table was so small... just like the service we got. Everything  super expensive but service poor and unprofessional. When I asked for a chilled white wine, They offered  a white wine with ice (¿!) Amazing!  Food ok...service...BAD!!! If They are going to charge...They should  deliver. What a disappointment!
616.name: Guillermo Martinez

617.review: Need to add more stuff to the menu. Choices are limited
617.name: TakaleN Jardine

618.review: We are going to TAU every time we visit NY. This time was bad. The service was awful and it seemed like the customer do not interest the waiters. The service was very slow and the food was only good for the price.
618.name: Gil Maya Rabinowitz

620.review: Lobster fried rice and tao-tinis were amazing!
620.name: Keshia Rimpel

621.review: Came for gala event. Food was great
621.name: Yossi L

622.review: I had a reservation, but when I arrived I was told I had to wait that my table was being prepared and I would get a text when it was ready. I waited 15 minutes and proceeded to ask the same girl I originally spoke to, how long would would the wait be.? With an attitude of disgust and annoyance, her response was that I had to wait on another table because the table they were preparing , the people sat back down. So I asked her for an estimated time and she said exasperatingly that it would be ready, when it’s ready. I don’t know if this is Tao’s policy but that needs to be changed. What’s the point of having a reservation if you can’t be seated in a timely manner and top of that can’t even get a estimated wait time. Then to be spoked too like that. It was very insulting. I waited again and after another 10-15 minutes I went to the other girl handling reservations and was seated right away.  The food is good, but nothing spectacular. The fortune cookie dessert was yummy. It is a pricey restaurant, but money was no issue here. However, the quality of a dish should live up to its price.You have to  know that when you go here you’ll be spending a lot. The ambiance is very nice.
622.name: Michelle G

623.review: Nice decor and atmosphere. Food and drinks were good. Not really authentic Chinese food but passable.
623.name: Johnny Chan

624.review: The best people watching in the world
624.name: Jason Cawthron

625.review: Wonderful experience to share an evening meal with friends and family in this restaurant!
625.name: Anna Yatskar

626.review: My favorite restaurant in NYC! Amazing food and great ambiance! Highly recommended!
626.name: Jose Eduardo Guzzardi

627.review: This is my third time at Tao and I once again don't get the hype of this restaurant. I ordered the Drunken Noodles. They bring me Pad Thai with lobster. It's $34 for mediocrity. And it wasn't even good Pad Thai it was overly sweet just so disappointed. The lobster was incredibly overcooked dry and rubbery. A friend next to me order the glazed salmon. Once again over cook the salmon which is amazing to me because it's such a simple more fatty fish. However it was so dry and lacking of salt and flavor. Another friend ordered the sea bass. Had better sea bass at other places still nothing amazing. The only thing that was halfway decent was their crispy Seafood roll and the $19 Tao martini. Tao is only good for having large parties. Is very dark almost feels dungeon-like. Yes the decor and artifacts in there are beautiful however it's still mediocre for the high overpriced unflavored dried out food. I'm way over this place I not returning they need to do better for their prices.
627.name: Lala A

628.review: Loved the cocktails, food, atmosphere and the fit out is WOW, cool neighbourhood with plenty of bars and places to see afterwards
628.name: John Curtin

629.review: The service is not that good. We had a open table reservation and arrived on time, but they kept us waiting for over 10 min to get the table ready. We went there during the restaurant week and I was so surprised that they picked Pad Thai and Mongolian Beef as their entree in the menu... My understanding is that these dishes are favorite in fast food / bistros / take out places. We ordered Pad Thai and another entree outside the restaurant week menu. Turns out that both of them are too salty to be good. Even the ice cream in the dessert is too salty. I'm Chinese who born and raised in mainland Chin, from my view the food there is neither good traditional American Chinese food, nor delicious new Asian fusion, of course, not authentic Asian taste as well. The ambient is fine but too noisy. I feel I would never go again.
629.name: Tao Guo

630.review: The ambience at Tao Downtown is amazing. The place is huge and the statues and paintings contribute well to an exotic environment. I had the Pama Sutra cocktail and it was delicious. We then had a number of appetizers including shishito peppers, edamame, salmon tartare and lobster wontons which were all good. For my entree, I had the pan roasted halibut which was the weakest part of the whole meal. I would go back but I would choose some other entree.
630.name: Denise K

632.review: The placeis very nice big and has a good environment the food was good  But the waiter was tide up nervous us to order all the food at the beginning and push us to order alot of ffod. My husband didnt feel good so we ask the waiter to cancel the remain order he said it's not possible and was unfriendly with that we ask to pack the food to take away he made us a "face and didnt neing us soy and chop sticks even with the take away
632.name: Gal Ashkenazi

633.review:
Very over priced. Food wasnt good but the setting was very nice. Wasted money
 We through out the food once we got home and one of my friends left her bag on the table.
633.name: Debbie G

634.review: Excellent Asian cuisine good place to take a friend to be entertained by the decor
634.name: John Carter

635.review: LOVE LOVE TAO downtown NYC great ambiance and food, very sexy
635.name: Ursallie Smith

637.review: Went for a birthday dinner. The food was delicious with the exception of the Pad Thai. I expected Pad Thai to be spicy, it came out sweet. The Spare Ribs were delicious to say the least. The meat just fell right off the bone. The prices are on the expensive side, but it is expected for a place like this. Definitely recommend for an anniversary or special occasion. The decor is really nice. They have tables on the staircase and a giant Buddha statue with different designs projected onto it. Have not been for the nightclub.
637.name: Ravi Patel

638.review: Tao is one of the the best restaurants/nightclub in Newyork. The restaurant has a clean environment, beautiful setup and design and the night club will keep your adrenaline rushing with great music, hot models and celebrities trooping in and out.
638.name: Bolu Olaitan

639.review: Love this place. Excellent atmosphere and food.
639.name: Jahn Andersen

640.review: Went on a business dinner. Great atmosphere, nice food
640.name: Elena Te

641.review: Very nice decor and ambiance, good drinks. Portions are small though and its overpriced but that's that's expected for the upscale restaurant it is.
641.name: Rosemarie Philip

642.review: It's a nice atmosphere, food was delicious and for that I gave it 4 stars, it is hard to get delicious quality food in New York these days.
642.name: Nicole Geddes

643.review: Wow! That's what I said when we entered the dining hall. It's huge and impressively decorated. The Buddha statue is changing its looks every 15 minutes. We've got 5 different appetizers and main course. Everything was pretty awesome. Especially satay sea bass and Thai chicken. The service was fine also but a little bit rushing. Great experience.
643.name: Dmytro Kovalenko

644.review: All I can say is wow
644.name: christopher roselli

645.review: Very extravagent, super trendy, very busy but great options in seating. Waiters were a bit busy,but not unreasonable with wait time. Food is much more expensive and so are the drinks. Dishes are more of a sweetened up asian fusion,not traditional,but still very delicious. Many options.
645.name: Jason Ramos

646.review: THIEVES HIDING IN THE CROWD. No stars. LADIES KEEP YOUR PURSES VERY CLOSE IF YOU DON'T WANT IT STOLEN AT TAO. The worst nightmare ever. What they don't advertise is that the place is way to noisy, crowded and that You should be careful because mixed in a crowd not controlled by enough cameras or security there are professional thieves and You can get your purse stolen. It happened to one of my friends Saturday evening. Yes inside the restaurant while seated and waiting for our food to arrive. We had just ordered. Women have purses that not necessarily fit as a cross body or in your lap.  My friend purse was across the shoulder of her chair and was stolen. We had just sat down and ordered our food. My friend turned around to put her phone back in her purse ... see had taken a picture of us sitting across from her. When she reach for her purse it was gone! Even though we reacted immediately calling the manager ... there was nothing to do. The cameras did not reveal anything suspicious, with the manager claiming that the area we were seated in, was a busy one. We obviously did not eat, had to call the police and our night out ended at 02:00 am when we were finally able to go back to the hotel.  Did I mention that in the purse unfortunately there were besides the money and credit cards, my friends documents she was visiting from Europe. We didn't have the chance to eat and we had to get into a not very pleasant conversation first with the waiter and then with the manager. We were asked to pay  the bill for the full dinner. We didn't even see them bring to food to the table. We ended up paying a portion of bill  to settle.  Not happy, not happy at all. SO LADIES KEEP YOUR PURSES VERY CLOSE IF YOU DON'T WANT IT STOLEN AT TAO.
646.name: Nadia De Ronch

647.review: Excellent food, personal service and exclusive atmosphere. Highly recommend
647.name: paul angresano

649.review: We went to celebrate our wedding anniversary here and we were impressed with this place! Stunning interior, great service and delicious food! Even though it was different from original Thai food we tried in Thailand. Huge thanks to the waiter who helped us to decide what to order and how many dishes. Oh, and coconut custard desert! 5 star! Excellent! Prices are high but it worth it.
649.name: Olga Kovalenko

650.review: Another obnoxious and way overpriced NYC tourist magnet. I give one star for the decor, which I admit is really cool. And one star for the giant fortune cookie desert which, at $14 is the only thing on the menu even slightly worth the visit or the money. The rest of the menu is lackluster at best, and hasn’t changed in decades. $44 for Mongolian Beef was awful. I couldn’t tell if the sauce was bad or the meat was rancid. Sushi is not bad, but if your a tourist and want good sushi with renowned atmosphere, walk through Chelsea market and hit Morimoto which is still decent (if not lavishly expensive) after all these years of hype. The management at Tao consists of various too-cool-for school characters who are too millennial to realize they are managing a tourist trap of 1990’s vintage, not a Michelin Star juggernaut. The final nail in the coffin was the check which included an extra $20 charge for 4 soda waters. That’s right! $5 for a soda water, and the manager refused to remove the charge. So, um, I refused to tip. Sorry. Net net, if you simply must visit this place for it’s selfie-worthy Buddha decor, just go for the fortune cookie desert and then scram!
650.name: Benjamin Flammang

651.review: Good atmosphere and a lot of fun!
651.name: Morgan Senick

652.review: One of our favorite visits in the city. Flavorful food and always leave happy. Brussels Sprouts are amazing.
652.name: Jeremy Skillings

653.review: We went here on our vacation to New York in December. We received by far the worst service I have ever experienced at any restaurant I have ever been to. There were only two of us, both under 21, and since the wait list for the dining room was so long, we opted to sit in the lounge. The waitress came by and was very rude while asking what we wanted to drink. All we asked for was water, as we were still looking at the menu. She walked away and never came back. She stared at us from the other end of the restaurant, basically waiting for us to leave. She proceeded to serve other parties around us, who had more people and were ordering alcohol. I reminded her TWICE that we had asked for water and she never got it or spoke to us again. I asked a different server for the manager, who never came to us. We waited for another 10 minutes and we were completely ignored.  It became clear that all these people cared about was tips and they refused to serve us based on our age and small party. We left without spending a dime or even getting a glass of water after a long day. I intend to return to New York, but plan to stay far away from this money-hungry tourist magnet. I suggest you do the same.
653.name: Jordyn Wehde

654.review: Always amazing. The ambiance is awesome, and food delicious. Get a few things and share them family style!
654.name: Nick Miceli

655.review: Best dinner I have ever had. Seriously, the food was that good and the service was outstanding
655.name: Dan DeOreo

656.review: Great food but a little too trendy.  Tacky crowd.  More popular with tourists and people from outside the city than New Yorkers who have moved on to better places.
656.name: scott gabrielle

657.review: I could not make any praise of this restaurent except the freshness of the ingredients for dishes. The food is above the average level among New York Oriental Foods. But I expected more, from it's fame and special dining environment.  Two stars, no more. I will not visit again.
657.name: HK F

659.review: Amazing food and location. Loved the atmosphere, and the staff. If you are in New York you have to dine here!!!
659.name: Susanne Wiborg

661.review: One of the best restaurant in the city..!
661.name: Ismail KAAN

662.review: Absolutely amazing! I love this place.
662.name: C Chung

663.review: Great ambience, friendly service, and good food.
663.name: Jennie Kim

664.review: Delicious food, Good music and such an amazing decor. Add cocktails that you can't stop drinking to that and this becomes a perfect place for a date or to have good time with family and friends. A bit on the higher side of the price but once in a while you deserve to treat yourself.
664.name: Sourabh Ajmera

667.review: The place is very trendy which features a humongous statue of the Buddhist goddess Quan Yin drenched in an aquatic light show and a koi pond below. Depending on how many drinks you've had, the place can seem like a cavernous temple, a highly stylized club, or just one big ball room. The food is good. On the negative side, the small tables are too close to each other and with barely any space to put all your food. The wait is at least 30-40 mins in spite of reservations. I took one star out for that.
667.name: Purvi Patel

668.review: I absolutely loved it. The waitress was extremely helpful in recommending dishes to share with my date. She recommended the Red Dragon Martini, which I fell in love with. The atmosphere is very unique it's relaxed but at the same time pretty lively. This is a perfect place for a business lunch/ dinner, or even a date!
668.name: Suveer Seemangal

669.review: Food was very delicious, and was beautifully presented to us. However, the service could have been better. We were not given water refills, and it was impossible to find our waitress when we wanted to ask for the bill.
669.name: Sofiya shabelnik

670.review: I only at at the Tao uptown location and I actually really liked it. Last night I went with my friend to the downtown location for the nightclub and I have never experienced the kind of behavior I got from the bouncer when I was there. I've been to nightclubs in Miami and Vegas so I know bouncers aren't the greatest people to deal with. They are rude, ill-mannered, and disrespectful to women. I was waiting with my friend right outside and the other bouncers ignored us as they were on their phones. I made a comment about how they shouldn't be on their phones and one bouncer stepped in and said in a rude way how do you know they're not working on their phone? First of all I wasn't even talking to that bouncer and he shot that answer to me in a rude way so I told him you are rude and he shot back with YOU ARE RUDE. Worst experience ever I don't know what kind of nightclub this is but it's not worth being treated like that for. Save yourself the time and go somewhere else to have fun it's unprofessional and degrading. Not only that he was being rude to another woman in front of us for whatever reason. Bouncers need to get off their phones and stop being rude and attend to the people trying to get in instead of ignoring them out on the cold streets of New York.
670.name: Shereen Fustok

671.review: Swanky restaurant. Good food and cocktails
671.name: Samantha Gutierrez

672.review: Good food, amazing ambient, good drink.
672.name: Gabriel Vilorio

673.review: Good but disappointed because she didn't swallow towards the end 🍆💦 what a waste
673.name: Orlando Bonilla

674.review: Good food. Crazy opulent atmosphere. Expensive
674.name: Glenn Berntson

675.review: What an unusually large subterranean place... Excellent food, friendly service.
675.name: John Gellatly

676.review: Great food, great atmosphere, friendly, helpful and prompt service. Would recommend the speciality dishes! Unlike anywhere in NYC.
676.name: Royce Moore

677.review: a visually stimulating experience from the moment you enter.  the grandness of the space is quiet powerful.  The food was great but not among the best cuisines i have enjoyed in NYC, however it did not disappoint.  Vibrant, high energy atmosphere that is great for dates, business dinners, or any celebration.
677.name: Sheryl Case

678.review: nice place to have a romantic date, food is a little pricey, but the portions are good. One of a kind experience.
678.name: D Gonzalez

679.review: Gorgeous venue, chic decor and amazing food. Order mango chilli margarita and chilean sea bass. Sushi and rock shrimp tempura was excellent. Make reservations or else you may only get to sit at the bar. Waitresses are a bit snobbish if you do not have reservations, so avoid walk ins.
679.name: Mahima Srivastava

680.review: Loved it!  Gorgeous venue, chic decor and amazing food. Order mango chilli margarita and chilean sea bass. Sushi and rock shrimp tempura was excellent. Make reservations or else you may only get to sit at the bar. Waitresses are a bit snobbish if you do not have reservations, so avoid walk ins.
680.name: Mary Albert

682.review:
I'm visiting from Florida and a friend told me about TAO it was a group of 4 of us, our server was Craig he was great, he gave great suggestions and was on top of everything water never ran out and he kept the drinks flowing. 

We just ordered a bunch of apps my favorite was the crispy spicy tuna.
We also had shishito peppers which I don't normally like peppers but it was good
682.name: justin justin

683.review: Excellent food, helpful staff, and a visual feast inside. Easy to walk past in the early evening as it has an understated entrance, but well worth a visit.
683.name: Philip Rush

684.review: Went with a group of friends for restaurant week, while on the whole30. Every single plate at this place has soy sauce in it, except the Branzino, when stripped of every other ingredient it comes with, which leaves you with a $44 plate of two small strips of fish. Place looks pretty cool, but you will be hangry in your pics with their Buddhas if you arrive hungry expecting a full plate.
684.name: Luis Alejandro Tapia

685.review: Excellent restaurant, a great experience for couples having a night out.
685.name: Smalls

686.review: The food was delicious the restaurant was absolutely beautiful the atmosphere was wonderful. I would love to come again. Menu was a little pricey but it was worth it.
686.name: Essence Higgs

687.review: This used to be the Hiro Ballroom. The renovation is Magnificent!! I definitely recommend eating here or having a drink at least because Tao is stunning and Beautiful.
687.name: Adrienne Lovely

688.review: The food here is just okay, but it's such an impressive spot. This is a great place to take a date or a client. If you haven't been here you should check it out.
688.name: Andres Alonso

689.review: Great food, great decor, friendly staff. Fun place for our company holiday party.
689.name: robertinthebush .

690.review: Really cool place! Tasty food and great atmosphere. Not cheap though.
690.name: Xo Xo

692.review: Nice Asian fusion. Lounge and bar was a nice place to hang.   Interesting, creative bar drinks. The restaurant was okay. Food was a little salty but good. Desserts were unique. Great selection of tea.   The only negative was the wait for a table though we had reservations.  If you have to wait for more than 30 mins with reservation....😕
692.name: Mei Tam

694.review: The atmosphere was amazing! Beautiful decor, I was celebrating a birthday, very good music, however is was extremely loud, we could not communicate without screaming across the table, I didn't mind that too much but the food was terrible. We all came to the same conclusion, it was very mediocre, there were about 10 of us.
694.name: Chawntell Seekina Powell

695.review: Great food, specially the fortune cookie
695.name: Electra

696.review: Ambience was great, very picturesque restaurant. Great saki selection, and good drink menu.
696.name: Michael Boland IV

697.review: The most impressive design in the city if u visiting ny u have to go have a look the place is run like a machine expensive but it’s a place to visit
697.name: Liav Horwitz

698.review:
Wow! Not enough great things to say about this place! After seeing so many posts of people coming here including many celebs I had to check it out. The atmosphere is like no other. If you're looking for a classy yet trendy place to be around a crowd 24+ this is the spot! The music was so on point (I had to bounce around a bit😜) and the service was very fast. Loved the decor and lighting, they even had these strange statues of these little boys bent over as if mooning you.😂😂

My friend and I enjoyed 2 martinis🍸 each while sitting in the bar area facing the floor. They even have 2 more private seating areas with glass walls overlooking the whole floor. My friend ordered Lamb Chops🍖 and Fluke Sushi 🍣 and I ordered Avacado + Cucumber   Sushi Rolls, a side of Asian Greens, and a side of rice🍚 which was enough for both of us to share. I was happy to see I could have some vegan options and we both enjoyed our food very much. The food came out surprisingly in less than 10 minutes despite the amount of people that were in there! It was delicious and we both enjoyed our food very much. There was security everywhere, the system and staff seemed organized, and the bathrooms were very clean as well.

We didn't check out the Tao club next door that night but most likely would've had my friend not had work the next day. Most certainly plan on coming back soon and checking out the club as well.

**If you are coming for a full meal (app, entree, dessert/drinks), call ahead to make a reservation for sure no matter the day. If you only want to come for drinks and maybe just a few apps you're allowed to sit at the tables in either of the bar areas and walk in and order there.

5/5
698.name: Anonymous

699.review: Probably the coolest restaurant I’ve ever been to in my life. My jaw was on the floor for the entirety of our visit.
699.name: Michael Palm

700.review: Great service, good food, stunning decor. Never had a bad time here.
700.name: Trey Rich

701.review: Exquisite, flashy, delicious, expensive. Would recommend for a special occasion.
701.name: Stas Perevozchikov

702.review: Tao is always the best decision!!!
702.name: Anton Beketov

704.review: Make sure to order the Special Dessert Platter (samples everything) its NOT on the Menu but offered when requested (so ask for it), it also comes with FUN naughty fortunes too 😉 hehe..( Pictured: Peking Duck, Pad Thai, Crispy Red Snapper, and Seafood Black Rice).
704.name: Christine Montierde

705.review: Nice fancy place, food is above average. It's interesting to see a place decorated with all the chinese elements but come out not Chinese at all.
705.name: Peng L

706.review: Used to be cool. Then losers from Jersey and club promoters started coming....
706.name: Mike S

707.review:
y you zone a Remem am m
Eels a iii ty
707.name: miguel cabrera

708.review: Pricy but worth it. The most beautiful place I've been in in a while.
708.name: Cire' Mitchell

709.review: Their Warm Chocolate cake comes with Salted Caramel flavored  Ice cream.  It was so creamy! Our waitress was super nice and attentive. Just go and view the ambiance! Really nice date night  place. Last but not least, the food is amazing. Everything is fresh and uber flavorful.
709.name: Tanya Tavaris

710.review: Huge bustling place with good vibes and food
710.name: Inder Sharma

711.review: Upscale restaurant with good food and cocktails. Nice place for night out.
711.name: Adam Iwanicki

712.review: Place and ambience is great. If you are a vegetarian definitely recommend vegetable dumplings!
712.name: Priya R

713.review: Food is good, but over priced. You're paying for a good experience, atmosphere, and the name Tag.
713.name: Chris Garcia

714.review:
An absolutely ridiculous dining experience. Very good food and drinks, but incredibly load. Felt like walking into the bar scene at the end of Dusk til Dawn, but with eclectic Eastern decor.

We laughed a lot and had to shout at each other to hold a conversation.
714.name: Kit Merritt

715.review: We had our company holiday party here. The appetizers were simply delightful. The meal itself was pretty good. Nice dance floor, nice ambience.  This is not my usual type of restaurant, but I could see myself coming here again. I thought they really seemed to do a nice job for us. One disappointment was that I was the contact person for our company bus. I tried to huddle in a quiet corner so that I could call the driver and let him know when to pick us up, and one really rude and obnoxious manager came over and kept trying to tell me to go out into the main area for the phone call. I had to tell him I couldn't hear the driver because the music was playing, and he couldn't have been any more obnoxious. I literally had to step outside the restaurant in order to complete the call. That was a one off of what otherwise was a very beautiful night for our company holiday party. In talking to many colleagues, it seems like the consensus was that we all had a great time.
715.name: Matt Alfieri

716.review: I got food poisoning and started throwing up at 12am
716.name: Akin Alexander

717.review: Not matching avryone. Really spicy food
717.name: koral

718.review: Great food great ambiance love the details around
718.name: Batul Abid

719.review: Delicious, worth trying. Some of the tenderness spare ribs I have ever had
719.name: Alfonso Harrison

720.review: Nice environment and good food. Sides should be included with shrimp that cost almost $40 though.
720.name: Da Guru

722.review:
I don't see the hype. 
The restaurant is nice, it's a bit loud, the tables are too far apart. I had to speak really loud to get my message through. The food was ok. Music wasn't that great. Food service was excellent. 
I don't think it's worth the high $$$.
722.name: Albert Ulep

725.review: Interesting place. Good food. Inattentive service.
725.name: Вася Теркин

726.review: Excellent food and the ambiance is insane.  I would give it 5 stars but they messed up our reservations and it was my wife's birthday so that was not cool on their part.  Sitting down 2 hours after your reservation is unacceptable.  We will come back for leisure but due to this experience, we can no longer bring our corporate clients....imagine waiting 2 hours to sit for dinner.
726.name: Nick Theofanis

727.review: Always show-stopping service and food here! Try the seabass satay it will change your life!!
727.name: Tessa Baldi

728.review: Probably the best vibe of any restaurant I know in or out of NYC. The downtown location is cooler than the midtown location. Unlike many style over substance restaurants, Tao actually has tremendous food.
728.name: Marco Roca

729.review: Trendy, fun, vibrant. Great cocktails, food and a place to be seen
729.name: Patricia

730.review:
Great vibe. Unfortunately nothing else impressed me. 

My salmon was over cooked and rubbery. The cocktails were inconsistent, ordered the ruby red at the upstairs bar and it was a strawberry, sweet, citrusy cocktail - tasted like a strawberry daquiri almost. The I ordered a blushing geisha at my table and was served... A ruby red? It was the same drink. Server was apologetic and told me I was mistaken. Frustrating because I ordered different drinks and certainly didn't receive what I ordered. 

Nothing horrible, however I wouldn't come back. There are many other places in town with a fun atmosphere and better cuisine.
730.name: Ella B

731.review: Came for restaurant week. The menu was great and I enjoyed each course. The vibe of the place was really cool and Id definitely come back here.
731.name: Victoria Rie Matsunaga

734.review: Nice ambiance, good food, attentive stadf5
734.name: A I

736.review: Great place, fun atmosphere, ok food, sub par cocktails
736.name: Siba Padhi

737.review: Beautiful place helpfull staff and tasting food. However we did wait over 1 hour for a table eventhough we had a reservation
737.name: Alberte Katrine Schmidt

738.review: Great food, staff and the ambience is an added bonus.
738.name: Larry Fellows III

739.review: Never in life have I been so degraded! Last night I gathered a group of my girl friends to this venue as a favor for a friend of a friend who just started promoting Tao night club. We were promised free entry, free drinks and free coat check and for 6 single young girls in college that sounded like a deal. Instead we got insulted, left out in the freezing cold and screamed at. I was in contact with the promoter the entire night prior to our arrival and when we got there not only were we waiting in line for over 30 minutes in the cold, the bouncer was so rude and arrogant screaming in my face specifically to "GET BACK" in order to have a conversation with him. When I initially just wanted to tell him who I was there for. To add injury to insult the promoter whom I had never met before, came outside seen our group and went back inside to text my phone to say "you're with a big girl we can't let you in I'm sorry!" Mind you not one of the beautiful ladies I was with was over a size 8. So if that's considered "big" to this pathetic club they should probably wake up and realize health is more important than being a size 2!!!!!!!! As a person in the fashion industry attending fashion shows with actual models and important people who actually matter, I have never been treated with such disrespect!!  Mark my words I would never do so much as to be on the same side of Tao night club/restaurant again!!!
739.name: Yashira Castro

740.review: First time I had sushi. Will not he last. The walkway to the tables is a experience within itself. The doors are medieval.
740.name: Kenneth Mcdevitt

741.review: I have frequented Tao Downtown for the past year with my friends. Last night after letting me in the establishment security asked my friend (whom has also been going to Tao for the past year) to wait. After approximately ten minutes I went to ask my friend if he was ok, and comfortable waiting. Before going in I asked one of the employees whom I had know for a year, what the issue was regarding my friend. Soon during my inquiry three security guards aggressively grabbed me and forced me outside of the entrance. I am a 20 year old 120 pound girl, that was in no way aggressive towards the staff. I had three men put their hands on me, grab my arms and push me outside of the entrance, despite my compliance in the situation.  I had none of my belongings because they were inside at the table me and friends of mine had service at, and none of the staff were willing to let me grab them so that I could go home. Personal possessions of mine had been taken within the time it took for a friend of mine to retrieve my bag. This is not the first time that I have experienced Tao's staff forcibly removing a non aggressive girl from the establishment, and leaving them in the streets without their belongings. I have never in my entire life had anyone put their hands on me, and how dare this poorly managed, sexist, and racist business have the audacity too. I have filed police reports against this business for their excessive use of force, and I hope that all of the other girls I've seen in this situation do the same.
741.name: Azali POWERS-JACKSON

743.review: Great food, great atmosphere. Friendly staff with a great tuesday night afterparty.
743.name: Terrance Wright

745.review: One of the best spots in Manhattan hands down. If you have a chance to get in, don't miss it! The club is beyond fun, and the food is even better! No matter what you decide to do here you can't go wrong!
745.name: Andrew Rabinowitz

746.review: Very cool place and atmosphere, very dark though, head to see inside
746.name: Mike DePetro

747.review: Overraded place. Rude staff. All the dishes came at the same time and we need to leave right away. We felt really unwelcome and unpleasent.
747.name: Guido van Grieken

748.review: Very noisy, but cool decor and great pan-asian food.
748.name: Dan Brooks

749.review: It's not like food is like WOW but good, but when you feel that you are paying more for food that is actually no better than some other Asian restaurants on the area (just to mention; Blue Ribbon - on sushi specialties, Xi'an - on price/food, Buddakan compare to room, decor & service?). Just because of the fact this a trendy place living by it's name. Then maybe this is a choice you should reconsider, or maybe do consider if you want to be dinning with your friend(s) or couple in a place that's "IN".
749.name: Jaffar Barjan

752.review: The food at Tao is delicious! I would recommend everything! The Mongolian Beef and cod were my favorite dishes!
752.name: Elizabeth Tam

754.review: Soo pricey and the DJ on the night I went (Thursday) could have been better. I just wanted a great night of dance but problem here is so many people are just there to walk around, pop bottles and show off so it's hard to fall into a trance of music and dance without being disturbed by people walking around and hosts delivering bottles
754.name: Munashe Makava

755.review: Food was great, but make sure you made a reservation
755.name: Vesselina Nikiforova

756.review:
Best upscale Chinese food in NYC! Trust me my last name is Tao so I would know. TAO has amazing Asian cuisine and it's quite authentic flavor wise. I brought my relatives from China here to try the food and they thought all the flavors were comparable to the top restaurants in China. The ambience is as always amazing, a little dark for old folk but cool for the younger crowd. 

We tried almost everything and it was all delicious. The typhoon lobster can probably feed 10 people with just the claw, it was the size of the dinner plate. The sand pit lobster was also delicious, the scallops amazing, the steaks perfect, the lamb chops cooked to perfection, and the kung pao chicken always a favorite. For appetizers, you have to try the spicy salmon on the crispy rice. We also tried the duck spring rolls and lobster wontons which were equally as delicious. 

I wish I owned this restaurant cause I would come back for lunch/dinner everyday.

Excellent food served by an excellent staff!
756.name: John Tao

757.review: 5 Stars for Ambiance decor & delicious food- just VERY expensive.
757.name: N Flamer

758.review: Great food , great service,  beutifull place
758.name: amado piedras

759.review:
Very good service. Food is great! Good music and service. 
Everyone should give this place a try...
759.name: Carlos Perez

760.review: Hands down the worst experience I've had in New York or miami. Absolutely awful. I recommend everyone I know to stay away. Zero privacy and they just want to take your money
760.name: JD Bechthold

761.review: The best place, the food is delicious!!
761.name: Y So

762.review: Horrendous service, very loud, and contrived atmosphere - I am Asian, and I am embarrassed by their decor. We made a reservation on Saturday evening and arrived on time. Because we brought 2 more friends with us, the restaurant refused to seat us. Instead they made us sit at the "Lounge Area" with coffee tables. I could not see what I was eating, and the bill had an error with an item we did not order. Prices are high, but would not be an issue for me if it was good food and good service. Obviously, TAO Downtown is not worth half the price they demanded.
762.name: W Nelson

763.review: It's an amazing place with good ambience and great food
763.name: Muthulakshmi B

765.review: The perfect restaurant to go to while in NYC.
765.name: L C

766.review: This place is one of the most beautiful restaurants in NYC. The light show on the statue is incredible. You need a reservation here, and may even have a wait for bar only. The food is delicious. Great place for a large party / celebration. Trendy crowd - make sure you are dressed for it!
766.name: Heather Teicher

767.review: Everyone here is personable. The food music and atmosphere is magical!!! ❤️
767.name: sabrina woods

768.review: Waiting too long even with reservation. Server was not professional.
768.name: Paul Cha

770.review: Great place to look at it, definitely a place to bring out-of-town guests; the atmosphere is unmatched.  My complaint is that I never feel quite satisfied with the amount of food plated despite spending $50+ per person.
770.name: Michael DiMaio

771.review: One of the worst service i ever had. Had a reservation a 8pm and i was late 5 mins and idk why but they made us wait for 1 hour because we were 5mins late
771.name: Ata Arslan

772.review: Mostly sharing food. Awesome drinks--martini. Really fun menu. Ends up being pretty pricey but it is good for occassions.
772.name: Kathryn Rogers

773.review: Food is out of this world and drinks are on point. You get what you pay for. Try the seabass skewers they kill
773.name: Zachary Ehrlich

774.review: Booked a table at 10, arrived 9:55 and Guess what? I got the table at 10:45!!!  Food is absolutely average big thumb for the atmosphere
774.name: hishph .

776.review: It's very nice reustaran! I recommend
776.name: Anna Anna

778.review: You can tell this will be an experience when you walk through the front doors.  The food is quite good here however service can take a little while once you arrive.
778.name: Vincent Liu

779.review: One of the most expensive places in Manhattan but you get what you pay for. Food is absolutely exceptional
779.name: James LaFond

780.review: Went here for a friend's Bday. I'm not too fancy, but I clean for these fancy places. It'd expensive 22-40 for a meal, I got the Hong Kong noodle dish (with pork and chicken I think) it was DELISH. The place is hoppin, it's a great open space, with great ambiance, bhuddist temple meets Indiana Jones meets a night club. For the restaurant go down the steps and figure out which rings to pull to get in. Don't worry, everyone is confused. All in all, great experience. My meal was about 22 bucks or so, but it was a lot and I was full. The waitstaff was nice but very impatient with no attempt to hide it. We had fun anyways! Thumbs up.
780.name: Dave Reed

781.review: Tao is known for excellent design and this Tao lives up to the expectation. The attention to detail and the quality of the furniture is amazing. The food is spectacular. Tasty and good portion sizes.
781.name: Levar Jackson

783.review: Great food! A little over priced...
783.name: Roee Matza

784.review:
Never Go To TAO Downtown Had My Worst Birthday Experience Ever.
One Of Their Staff STOLE MY GUCCI SANDALS
 I Went Upstairs For 5 Minutes Realized I Left My Sandals At The Dinner Table Went Back Downstairs & It Was Gone 
Their Staff That Cleaned The Table Refused To Look For My Belongings And Their Manager "Adam" Told Us We Had To Leave Even Called Security To Escort Us Out Because They Didn't Want To Help Us After Spending Hundreds Of Dollars At Their Establishment This Is How I Was Treated SMFH 😡😡😡😡 This Is Why You Can't Support These Establishments. I Would Never Step Foot In That Place Again
And clearly this is an ongoing issue as I see another review with a women who got her purse stolen  there a week ago
The employees are thieves and have people in their establishment who are stealing the customers property 
Management is unprofessional and the food was disgusting please ladies do not go to this restaraunt if you don't want to have your property stolen
784.name: Nicole Jones

955.review:
DISPICABLE SERVICE from KEVIN
Where do I begin?! Let me just start by saying that my girlfriends and I have NEVER been treated as poorly as were by Kevin at Tao Downtown  Saturday August 12. The only reason I gave this a 1 star is because we were seated despite being late for our reservation. We were in town in NY for my bachelorette party weekend and were all so excited to dine at your establishment. The excitement quickly turned sour as we were seated and watched Kevin (who we later found out would be our server) walk past our table over 15 times serving everyone else except us. At some point, some 20 mins later he lack lustrely moseys over and takes our order. During the course of the next hour we had to practically wave our hands to get his attention all while we observed him laughing and giggling with the other 2 tables (one beside us and one in front of us) while he waited on them hand and foot. Turned off as yet? Well there's more. To add insult to injury, after our entrée, (with ample time left on the reservation) Kevin made sure to have our table cleared and then flung our check on the table. No dessert menu, no coffee offer, no more wine, water NOTHING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. At that point I told him that it would have been nice had he offered us dessert before hastily bringing the check to which he replied" OH, OKAY" and walked off. 

TAO, I have never in my entire life been treated as poorly as I was on Saturday night, August 12, 2017. You RUINED what was to be such a fantastic experience for me and my friends. The sad part is that your waiter was so busy being rude that he hasn't yet realized what he has done. Since we are business women we tipped him regardless. Because to stoop to the level of ignorance would be to be ignorant. I'm appalled that you have hired such an incompetent waiters at such a prestigious establishment. It just goes to show: not all that glitters is gold.
955.name: Tara J

1022.review:
Dining here was an amazing experience. The interior is gorgeous. The dining area is a bit unique, they have a "stadium style" lounge area, which serves a full menu and looks down over the rest of the dining room and right toward the main attraction, a massive 24 armed statue of Quan Yin that has a projector rotating through unique calming displays. Falling leaves, running water and growing moss are just a few of the projections I noticed.

Outside of what you see (really, go check out some photos!), the food was amazing. We started with the Satay of Chilean Sea Bass, and it was one of the best cooked seafood dishes I have ever tasted. After that, we went with the Crunch Spicy Yellowtail roll and then had the Drunken Pad Thai for our main meal. For desert, we had the Bread Pudding Doughnuts,  which were incredible. 

This is not just a dinner, it is a whole experience, and I highly suggest you go check it out.
1022.name: Cooper Fellows

1053.review: Absolutely disgusted with our expirence at Tao, if you even want to call it that. Came from Boston for a bachelorette party. One of the girls was in touch with Francisco a Tao promoter to help us get in since we had about 8 girls in our party. We met him in the line and he saw who we were with and pointed us out to the bouncer, who refused to even make eye contact with any of us. They went back and forth whispering with eachother, while we froze in line for over an hour watching the bouncer point to everyone surrounding us and behind us and let them in. It was very clear he was allowing everyone but us in. He would pick people directly around us and behind us and let them in. Finally after wasting enough time we asked the promoter what was happening and he replied that we would not be let in tonight (no reasoning why) and that we should find "other plans". We ended up leaving and going to the place next door. I've been out plenty of times around Boston and dealt with some rude bouncers but this was HORRIBLE. Save your money and go somewhere else.
1053.name: Siobhan Riley
